translated: their heads, mouths, eyes, ears, noses, faces, complexions, shapes, forms, birthplaces, and types of food are all different.

original: kye padma'i snying po /
analyzed: kye padma'i snying po /
translated: “O Padmagarbha,

original: 'di lta ste; ba lang dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / khyi dang / rnga mo dang / ri dvags dang / bya dang / ra lug rnams sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; ba lang dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / khyi dang / rnga mo dang / ri dvags dang / bya dang / ra lug rnams sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang /
translated: cows, horses, donkeys, dogs, camels, deer, birds, goats, and sheep are born from eggs, from wombs, from heat and moisture, and spontaneously.

original: brdzus te skyes pa rnams kyis sems can rnams tha dad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: brdzus te skyes pa rnams kyis sems can rnams tha dad par shes par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: yang rkang pa dang / gdeng pa dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / zas dang / skyes gnas kyi sna tshogs par yang shes par bya'o //

analyzed: yang de lta bas na rigs bzhi po rnams tha dad par shes par mi bya'o //

analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dag bram ze rnams dang 'dra zhing gcig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are similar and the same as the brahmins.

original: shing 'di dag kyang gang gi 'bras bu aa mra dang / 'dzam bu dang / khardzu ra dang / pa na sa dang / pha le pa dang / dge tsa ka dang / rgun 'brum dang / dpyi zor dang / ka pi ta dang / starga dang /
analyzed: shing 'di dag kyang gang gi 'bras bu aa mra dang / 'dzam bu dang / khardzu ra dang / pa na sa dang / pha le pa dang / dge tsa ka dang / rgun 'brum dang / dpyi zor dang / ka pi ta dang / starga dang /
translated: These trees should be understood as having various fruits, such as mangoes, rose apples, pomegranates, breadfruit, palmyra nuts, coconuts, grapes, jujubes, kapitthas, and dates.

original: na le ke ra dang / ting ni ka dang / sardza ka dang / 'bras bu dang ldan pa sna tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: na le ke ra dang / ting ni ka dang / sardza ka dang / 'bras bu dang ldan pa sna tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as having various fruits, such as nīlikas, tindukas, and sārjakas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: In this way,

original: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / shun lpags kyi @384a *//
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / shun lpags kyi @384a *//
translated: the trunk, the bark,

original: cha dang / me tog dang / mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: cha dang / me tog dang / mtha' yas pa ste /

analyzed: lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / sna tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The leaves, flowers, fruits, and the various [types of trees] should be understood.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i me tog rnams sna tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i me tog rnams sna tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The flowers without fruits should be understood as various [types].

original: yang de bas rigs bzhi po rnams tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang de bas rigs bzhi po rnams tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, those four types are not different.

original: bram ze / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bram ze / 'di lta ste /
translated: Brahmin, it is like this:

original: 'di dag ni skam las skyes pa'i shing ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni skam las skyes pa'i shing ste /

original: sa la dang / na da dang / ta ma la dang / kar ni ka dang / lo ma bdun pa dang / sha ri sha dang / 'o bo da ra dang / tsandan dang / sha ba dang / da pa dang / seng ldeng la sogs pa sna tshogs par rig par bya'o; ;'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa la dang / na da dang / ta ma la dang / kar ni ka dang / lo ma bdun pa dang / sha ri sha dang / 'o bo da ra dang / tsandan dang / sha ba dang / da pa dang / seng ldeng la sogs pa sna tshogs par rig par bya'o; ;'di lta ste /
translated: The various [types] should be understood as the earth, the nāḍa, the tamāla, the karṇikāra, the seven-leaved, the śārisha, the oboḍara, the sandalwood, the śāva, the dāpa, the kṣīraka, and so forth.

original: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / shun lpags kyi cha dang / me tog tsam dang / snying po dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu sna tshogs par rig par bya'o;/
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / shun lpags kyi cha dang / me tog tsam dang / snying po dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu sna tshogs par rig par bya'o;/
translated: The four castes should be known as the different parts of a tree, such as the root, the trunk, the bark, the flower, the heartwood, the leaves, the flowers, and the fruits.

original: yang de bas na rigs bzhi po'i rigs rnams la tha dad pa med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de bas na rigs bzhi po'i rigs rnams la tha dad pa med par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the castes should be known as undifferentiated within the four castes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'di dag ni 'o ma can gyi shing ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'o ma can gyi shing ste /

analyzed: au dum ba ra dang / pa la ksha dang / aa shvad tha dang / n+ya gro dha dang / bal gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa sna tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: the udumbara, the plaksha, the aśvattha, the nyagrodha, the bhallātaka, and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / shun lpags kyi cha dang / me tog tsam dang / snying po dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu rnams tha dad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / shun lpags kyi cha dang / me tog tsam dang / snying po dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu rnams tha dad par rig par bya'o //
translated: the root, the trunk, the bark, the flower, the heartwood, the leaves, the flowers, and the fruits should be known as different.

original: yang de bas na rigs bzhi po'i rigs rnams la tha dad pa med par shes par @384b bya'o; ;padma'i snying po /
analyzed: yang de bas na rigs bzhi po'i rigs rnams la tha dad pa med par shes par @384b bya'o; ;padma'i snying po /
translated: Therefore, the castes should be known as undifferentiated within the four castes.🔽O Padmagarbha,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: yang 'di dag ni 'bras bu sman du gyur pa'i shing rnams te /
translated: These are the trees that bear medicinal fruits:

analyzed: aa ma la dang / aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra dang / aa ru sha ka la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang /

analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i sman rigs sna tshogs pa las skyes pa dang / rtsva dang / nags nas skyes par tha dad med par shes par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: yang de bas na rigs bzhi po rnams la tha dad med par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should know that there is no difference between the four castes.

original: bram ze / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bram ze / 'di lta ste /
translated: Brahmin, it is as follows:

original: 'di dag ni thang las skyes pa'i me tog rnams te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni thang las skyes pa'i me tog rnams te /
translated: These are the flowers that grow on dry land:

analyzed: aa ti mug ta ka dang / tsam pa ka dang / pa ta la dang / su ma na dang / pa ri sha ka dang / da tsu ka ra la sogs pa sna tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: the atimuktaka, champak, pāṭala, sumana, pāripāṭaka, and other various flowers.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: gzugs dang / kha dog dang / dri dang / dbyibs sna tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that there are various forms, colors, smells, and shapes.

original: bram ze / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bram ze / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Brahmin, it is like this:

analyzed: 'di dag ni chu las skyes pa'i me tog ste /
translated: These are the water-born flowers:

analyzed: padma dang / autpa la dang / ku mu ta dang / soo gandi ka dang / dri zhim la sogs pa sna tshogs par rig par bya'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: the lotus, the blue lotus, the white lotus, the red lotus, the jasmine, and so forth.

analyzed: gzugs dang / dri dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs tha dad par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as having different forms, smells, colors, and shapes.

original: yang de bas na rigs bzhi po'i rigs rnams la tha dad pa med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de bas na rigs bzhi po'i rigs rnams la tha dad pa med par shes par bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, Brahmin, the four castes should be known as undifferentiated.

original: bram ze / bram ze'i rigs kyang de lta bu'o //🔽rje'u rigs kyang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: bram ze / bram ze'i rigs kyang de lta bu'o // rje'u rigs kyang de lta bu'o //
translated: Brahmin, the Brahmin caste is like that.🔽The warrior caste is like that.🔽The merchant caste is like that.

original: dmangs rigs kyang de lta bu yin te /
analyzed: dmangs rigs kyang de lta bu yin te /
translated: The laborer caste is like that.

analyzed: de bas na thams cad gcig pa yin no // gzhan yang / khyod la bram ze rnams @385a *//
translated: Therefore, all are the same.

original: kyi rtogs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: kyi rtogs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: “Moreover, Brahmin, I will tell you the story of the Brahmins.

analyzed: 'di ltar skye dgu'i bdag po tshangs pa'i nam mkha' skar ma'i tshogs dang bcas pa ni mgo bo yin no //
translated: Brahma, the lord of beings, together with the host of stars in the sky, is the head.

original: lto ba ni ri rnams yin no //
analyzed: lto ba ni ri rnams yin no //
translated: The belly is the mountains.

original: brla gnyis dang / rkang pa gnyis ni sa'o //
analyzed: brla gnyis dang / rkang pa gnyis ni sa'o //
translated: The two thighs are the earth, and the two feet are the moon.

original: mig gnyis ni nyi ma dang zla'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis ni nyi ma dang zla'o //
translated: The two eyes are the sun and moon.

original: ba spu rnams ni rtsa dang / nags kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: ba spu rnams ni rtsa dang / nags kyi tshogs so //
translated: The body hairs are the grass and forest groves.

original: nam mkha' las char 'bab pa ni mchi ma'o //🔽chu bo rnams ni de'i gcin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' las char 'bab pa ni mchi ma'o // chu bo rnams ni de'i gcin no //
translated: The rain falling from the sky is tears.🔽The rivers are his urine.

original: mtsho rnams ni de'i mi gtsang ba yin no //
analyzed: mtsho rnams ni de'i mi gtsang ba yin no //
translated: The lakes are his impurities.

original: de lta bu ni skye dgu'i bdag po tshangs par 'dod do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni skye dgu'i bdag po tshangs par 'dod do //
translated: Such is the lord of beings, Brahmā.

original: tshangs pa rang gi mtshan nyid ni de lta yin par rigs sam /
analyzed: tshangs pa rang gi mtshan nyid ni de lta yin par rigs sam /
translated: Is it reasonable to assert that Brahmā has such characteristics?

original: khyod rang gis dpyod cig /🔽tshangs pa gang yin pa de las bram ze rnams kyang byung /
analyzed: khyod rang gis dpyod cig / tshangs pa gang yin pa de las bram ze rnams kyang byung /
translated: You should examine this yourself.🔽From Brahmā himself, brahmins arose.

original: rgyal rigs rnams kyang byung /🔽rje'u rigs kyang byung /
analyzed: rgyal rigs rnams kyang byung / rje'u rigs kyang byung /
translated: From him, the warrior class arose.🔽From him, the merchant class arose.

original: dmangs rigs rnams kyang byung bar gyur cing /
analyzed: dmangs rigs rnams kyang byung bar gyur cing /
translated: From him, the laborer class arose.

original: de ltar na gal te skyes par nges par gyur na yang 'di ltar 'gyur zhing rigs bye brag tu byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te skyes par nges par gyur na yang 'di ltar 'gyur zhing rigs bye brag tu byas par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were certain that he was born, then it would be like this and the classes would be distinguished.

original: bram ze rnams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar 'gyur zhing rigs gsum po mtho ris su mi 'gro na ni de ltar na rigs bye brag tu byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram ze rnams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar 'gyur zhing rigs gsum po mtho ris su mi 'gro na ni de ltar na rigs bye brag tu byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Brahmins alone go to the world of Brahma, and the other three castes do not go to heaven, then the castes would be distinguished.

original: de lta ma yin na rigs bzhir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rigs bzhir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no four castes.

original: gang gi phyir rigs bzhi po tha dad pa rnams ni dge ba'i las byas pas mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs bzhi po tha dad pa rnams ni dge ba'i las byas pas mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because the four castes are distinguished, they go to heaven by performing virtuous actions.

original: yang des na drang srong rnams kyang zhi ba'i dka' thub spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang des na drang srong rnams kyang zhi ba'i dka' thub spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even the sages practice the austerities of peace.

original: de'i phyir bram ze rnams @385b la khyad par du gyur pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bram ze rnams @385b la khyad par du gyur pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no distinction for the Brahmins.

original: gal te bram ze gcig la 'dir lce gnyis yod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te bram ze gcig la 'dir lce gnyis yod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If one Brahmin here had two tongues,

original: de bzhin dbang po gnyis dang / rva bzhi dang / mgo bo gnyis yod na de lta na bram ze'i rigs khyad par du byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin dbang po gnyis dang / rva bzhi dang / mgo bo gnyis yod na de lta na bram ze'i rigs khyad par du byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and likewise two sense faculties, four ribs, and two heads, then the Brahmin caste would be distinguished.

original: chags pas phyin nas gzhan dag gsod pa dang / de lta bur 'gro zhing gnod par byed pa dang / sems can rnams la las kyi sun 'byin zhing des yang 'di ltar bram ze rnams ni mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin no //
analyzed: chags pas phyin nas gzhan dag gsod pa dang / de lta bur 'gro zhing gnod par byed pa dang / sems can rnams la las kyi sun 'byin zhing des yang 'di ltar bram ze rnams ni mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin no //
translated: Thus, brahmins are nonvirtuous friends.🔽Fighting and quarreling, they even fight with their fathers.

original: 'thab cing rtsod pa dang / pha dang yang 'khrug cing ba lang gsod par sems pa ni 'dir bram ze rnams kyi lugs so //
analyzed: 'thab cing rtsod pa dang / pha dang yang 'khrug cing ba lang gsod par sems pa ni 'dir bram ze rnams kyi lugs so //
translated: The thought to kill cows is the way of brahmins here.

original: srid srung gi rig byed las sngags kyis skrag par byed pa ni bram ze rnams kyi bya ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: srid srung gi rig byed las sngags kyis skrag par byed pa ni bram ze rnams kyi bya ba yin par bstan to //
translated: In the Veda of the Protector of Existence, it is taught that the activity of brahmins is to frighten with mantras.🔽They commit sins, deceive many people, and are deceitful and unbearable.

original: sdig pa byed pa dang / skye bo du ma slu ba dang / sgyu dang / mi bzad pa de lta bu'i rnyog pas 'di ltar pha rol la gnod pa rjes su sems shing de'i rjes la mtho ris nyid du 'gro bar 'dod na de mtho ris kyi lam ma yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa dang / skye bo du ma slu ba dang / sgyu dang / mi bzad pa de lta bu'i rnyog pas 'di ltar pha rol la gnod pa rjes su sems shing de'i rjes la mtho ris nyid du 'gro bar 'dod na de mtho ris kyi lam ma yin te /
translated: Thus, they think about harming others and after that, they desire to go to the higher realms. But that is not the path to the higher realms.

original: bram ze / gang zhig dka' thub mchog gis thul zhing brtul zhugs dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa mi 'tshe zhing zhi ba la mngon par dga' ba'i bram ze ni tshangs pa'i gnas su skye'o //🔽sha dang rus par bcas pa dang / sen mo dang bcas pa dang / pags pa dang bcas pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gcin dang / phyis ldan par gcig la dbang po rnams la khyad par med pas de'i phyir rigs @386a *//
analyzed: bram ze / gang zhig dka' thub mchog gis thul zhing brtul zhugs dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa mi 'tshe zhing zhi ba la mngon par dga' ba'i bram ze ni tshangs pa'i gnas su skye'o // sha dang rus par bcas pa dang / sen mo dang bcas pa dang / pags pa dang bcas pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gcin dang / phyis ldan par gcig la dbang po rnams la khyad par med pas de'i phyir rigs @386a *//
translated: Brahmin, the one who is tamed by the highest austerity, who is endowed with discipline and vows, who is harmless and delights in peace, that Brahmin is born in the realm of Brahma.

original: bzhi nyid du ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi nyid du ma grub pa'o //
translated: Since there is no difference in the faculties of one who possesses flesh, bones, nails, skin, pleasure, pain, urine, and feces, therefore the caste system is not established.

original: bram ze / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bram ze / 'di lta ste /
translated: Brahmin, it is like this:

original: yang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la bu bzhi yod par gyur la /
analyzed: yang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la bu bzhi yod par gyur la /
translated: Suppose there is a man who has four sons,

original: de dag la ming dga' byed ces bya ba dang / 'tsho byed ces bya ba dang / mya ngan med ces bya ba dang / tshe brgya pa zhes bya bar btags pas /
analyzed: de dag la ming dga' byed ces bya ba dang / 'tsho byed ces bya ba dang / mya ngan med ces bya ba dang / tshe brgya pa zhes bya bar btags pas /
translated: and they are named Nanda, Jīvaka, Aśoka, and Śatāyus.

original: padma'i snying po /
analyzed: padma'i snying po /
translated: Padmagarbha,

original: skyes bu de'i bur gyur pa de las dga' byed ces bya ba des dga' bar byed dam; 'tsho byed ces bya ba des 'tsho bar byed dam /
analyzed: skyes bu de'i bur gyur pa de las dga' byed ces bya ba des dga' bar byed dam; 'tsho byed ces bya ba des 'tsho bar byed dam /
translated: Is the son of that man called “joy” because he brings joy, or is he called “life” because he brings life,

original: mya ngan med ces bya ba des yid bde bar byed dam /
analyzed: mya ngan med ces bya ba des yid bde bar byed dam /
translated: or is he called “no sorrow” because he brings happiness?

original: gang tshe brgya pa zhes bya ba des lo brgya 'tsho bar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang tshe brgya pa zhes bya ba des lo brgya 'tsho bar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that he is called “one hundred years” because he lives for one hundred years.

original: yang bram ze de dag ni ming gis tha dad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang bram ze de dag ni ming gis tha dad par rig par bya'o //
translated: But those brahmins are to be known as different by name,

original: rigs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: not by family.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar pha yang gcig las skyes pa'i bu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha yang gcig las skyes pa'i bu yin te /
translated: Because the son is born from one father.

original: de la 'dir bod pa'i ched du pha dang / ma dang / spun zla dang / nye dus btags pa de nyid rigs yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir bod pa'i ched du pha dang / ma dang / spun zla dang / nye dus btags pa de nyid rigs yin te /
translated: Here, the family is just that designation by father, mother, brother, and relatives.

original: gang de ltar rnam par shes pa de las gzhan du gyur pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang de ltar rnam par shes pa de las gzhan du gyur pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is nothing else that is different from that consciousness.

original: bram ze / bdag nyid legs par dpyod cing /
analyzed: bram ze / bdag nyid legs par dpyod cing /
translated: Brahmin, examine yourself well.

original: bram ze'i rigs zhes bya ba dang / rje'u rigs zhes bya ba dang / dmangs rigs zhes bya ba gang zhig yin /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs zhes bya ba dang / rje'u rigs zhes bya ba dang / dmangs rigs zhes bya ba gang zhig yin /
translated: What is called the brahmin class, the kṣatriya class, the vaiśya class, and the śūdra class?

original: rgyu thams cad kyis lag pa 'jas pa dang / sgur po dang / 'gog pa dang / 'brum bu dang / mdze dang / sha bkra dang / tha dad pa rab tu gnas te /
analyzed: rgyu thams cad kyis lag pa 'jas pa dang / sgur po dang / 'gog pa dang / 'brum bu dang / mdze dang / sha bkra dang / tha dad pa rab tu gnas te /
translated: All causes are established as different: some have arms that are too long, some are hunchbacked, some are crippled, some have leprosy, some have tuberculosis, some have albinism, and so on.

original: sha dang / klad pa dang / pags pa dang / gzhung pa dang / rtsib logs dang / @386b gsum pa dang / bzhin rang rang gi las kyis grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sha dang / klad pa dang / pags pa dang / gzhung pa dang / rtsib logs dang / @386b gsum pa dang / bzhin rang rang gi las kyis grub pa yin te /
translated: Flesh, brains, skin, intestines, ribs, bones, and faces are established by their own karma.

original: de lta bu'i 'gro ba la bram zer gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'gro ba la bram zer gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin /
translated: In this world, there are no brahmins.

original: gang gis rigs khyad par du byas pa de bas na rigs yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang gis rigs khyad par du byas pa de bas na rigs yod pa ma yin /
translated: Since there is no distinction of class, there is no class.

original: bye brag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no difference.

original: rigs bzhi nyid du ma grub bo //
analyzed: rigs bzhi nyid du ma grub bo //
translated: The four classes are not established.

original: de lta bas na bram ze khyod la bdag 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na bram ze khyod la bdag 'di skad smra ste /
translated: Therefore, O brahmin, I say this to you:

original: gang 'jig rten 'di'i bram ze zhes bya ba dang / rgyal rigs zhes bya ba dang / rje'u rigs zhes bya ba dang / dmangs rigs zhes bya ba 'di dag gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten 'di'i bram ze zhes bya ba dang / rgyal rigs zhes bya ba dang / rje'u rigs zhes bya ba dang / dmangs rigs zhes bya ba 'di dag gcig pa yin te /
translated: “The so-called brahmins, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, and śūdras in this world are the same.

original: thams cad la tha dad pa ni med do //
analyzed: thams cad la tha dad pa ni med do //
translated: There is no difference among them.

original: de bas na bdag gi bu gzhon nu stag rna la bu mo gzugs bzang mo chung ma'i don du byin cig /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi bu gzhon nu stag rna la bu mo gzugs bzang mo chung ma'i don du byin cig /

original: rin du gang phab cing 'dod pa de sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rin du gang phab cing 'dod pa de sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “I will give whatever price you set.”

original: de lta bu'i tshig gdol pa'i rgyal po tre shang ku las thos pa dang / bram ze padma'i snying pos 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshig gdol pa'i rgyal po tre shang ku las thos pa dang / bram ze padma'i snying pos 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: yang ci khyod kyis nges brjod kyi rig byed kyang bklags / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed kyang bklags /

analyzed: snyan dngags kyi rig byed kyang bklags / srid srung gi rig byed kyang bklags /

analyzed: tshe'i rig byed kyi cho ga yang bklags /

analyzed: nang gi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor khyod kyis bklags sam /

original: gzhan yang / yan lag gi rig pa dang / dngos po brtag pa dang / bkra shis pa'i ltas dang / la nye brtag pa yang bslabs shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang / yan lag gi rig pa dang / dngos po brtag pa dang / bkra shis pa'i ltas dang / la nye brtag pa yang bslabs shing /

original: gzhan yang / khyod kyis sgra gcan 'dzin gyi 'gros dang / gza'i 'gros dang / pa ba sangs kyi 'gros khyod kyis @387a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyod kyis sgra gcan 'dzin gyi 'gros dang / gza'i 'gros dang / pa ba sangs kyi 'gros khyod kyis @387a *//
translated: Moreover, have you read the movements of Rāhu, the movements of the planets, and the movements of the moon?

original: bklags sam / gzhan yang /
analyzed: bklags sam / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: khyod kyis 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa'i gsung rab dang / bya ka ra na rnams dang / zla ba phyed pa rnams bklags sam /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa'i gsung rab dang / bya ka ra na rnams dang / zla ba phyed pa rnams bklags sam /
translated: have you read the Lokāyata, the scriptures of the Vātsīputrīyas, the Kāraṇḍavyūha, and the Ardhamāsika?

original: de skad ces dris pa dang / gdol pa'i rgyal po tre shang kus /
analyzed: de skad ces dris pa dang / gdol pa'i rgyal po tre shang kus /
translated: When this was asked, the caṇḍāla king Triśaṅku

original: bram ze padma'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: bram ze padma'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to the brahmin Padmagarbha:

original: bram ze / de bzhin te /
analyzed: bram ze / de bzhin te /
translated: “Brahmin, it is so.

original: bdag gis de dag yang dang yang du rgya cher bklags te /
analyzed: bdag gis de dag yang dang yang du rgya cher bklags te /
translated: I have read those extensively again and again.

analyzed: bram ze / 'di ltar bdag ni 'dir rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob par gyur pa yin te /
translated: “Brahmin, in this way I have attained the perfection of knowledge here.

analyzed: de lta bas na khyod la bram ze'i lhan cig pa'i chos de dag rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas bshad par bya'o //

original: bram ze / bskal pa dang po sngon byung ba na /
analyzed: bram ze / bskal pa dang po sngon byung ba na /
translated: Brahmin, in the past, in the first eon,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: bram ze'i rigs zhes bya ba dang / rgyal rigs zhes bya ba dang / rje'u rigs zhes bya ba dang / dmangs rigs zhes bya ba 'di thams cad gcig ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs zhes bya ba dang / rgyal rigs zhes bya ba dang / rje'u rigs zhes bya ba dang / dmangs rigs zhes bya ba 'di thams cad gcig ste /

original: tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: tha dad pa med do //
translated: There is no difference.

analyzed: de dag gi nang nas sems can 'ga' zhig gis 'di snyam du bsams nas /

analyzed: nad kyis yongs su bar du gcod pa dang / lba ba'i bar chad dang / zug rngu'i bar chad @387b gang yin pa bdag gis bar chad rnams spangs nas dgon par phyin la rtsva dang / shing dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma dang /
translated: “We will give up our obstacles, such as those caused by illness, goiters, and pain, and go to the wilderness. There we will make huts of grass, wood, leaves, branches,

analyzed: yal ga rnams las rtsva'i spyil bu dang / lo ma'i spyil bu byas nas bsam gtan byed cing gnas te /

analyzed: dus tshigs su zas don du gnyer bar nang par grong du bsod snyoms su rgyu'o //

analyzed: de nas grong khyer na gnas pa'i sems can rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the beings who lived in the village thought,

analyzed: kye ma / sems can 'di dag ni mchog tu dga' ba byed pa ste /
translated: “Oh! These beings are doing something very pleasant.

analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su spangs nas grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul nas 'phags pas; de dag la phyi rol tu dga' ba /

analyzed: phyi rol tu dga' ba zhes tha snyad du byas so //

analyzed: de la grong khyer na gnas pa rnams 'di skad du 'di 'ba' zhig yin gyi /

analyzed: sems can gzhan klog tu 'jug pas sems can de la klog tu 'jug pa /

analyzed: yid sdud la ni bcu'o //

analyzed: bdag ni bram ze rnams kyi srid srung gi sde tshan yin no //

analyzed: yang rig byed bcu drug gi dbye ba sngon gyi bram ze gang yin pa rnams kyis yang dag par bstan to //

original: khong du chud do //
analyzed: khong du chud do //

analyzed: de bas na 'di dag thams cad gcig nyid du shes par byas te /

analyzed: bram ze de bas na 'di dag ni 'jig rten gyi ming tsam te /

analyzed: tha snyad tsam du bstan te /

translated: The brahmin Padmaketu, however, was seen to be despondent, with his shoulders drooping, his head down, and no reply.

original: mthong nas kyang 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: gang zhig snod ldan gyi mchod sbyin byin cing /

translated: They perform the horse sacrifice, the human sacrifice, the sacrifice of correct conduct, and the sacrifice without rules. When they separate from their bodies, they will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in Moving in the WInd.

analyzed: de lta bas na bram ze khyod la bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: chos kyi gdol ba mi gtsang ba ni ma yin no //

original: gzhan yang / bram ze /
analyzed: gzhan yang / bram ze /

analyzed: sna tshogs du ma'i mchod sbyin 'dir //

original: rnam pa brgyad du nges par bstan //

analyzed: ma mnyam sring mo'i 'jig rten te //

original: rab tu 'jug ldan 'di lta ste //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug ldan 'di lta ste //

original: yang gang gi tshe zla ba dang / rgyu skar gnyis lhan cig du 'jug pa de lta bu ni 'dir zung du 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe zla ba dang / rgyu skar gnyis lhan cig du 'jug pa de lta bu ni 'dir zung du 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the moon and the lunar mansion enter together, this is called the pair entering together.

original: gzhan yang / padma'i snying po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / padma'i snying po /
translated: Furthermore, O Padmagarbha,

original: gza' rnams bshad par bya yi nyon cig /
analyzed: gza' rnams bshad par bya yi nyon cig /
translated: listen as I explain the planets.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: pa bsangs dang / gza' lhag pa dang / spen pa dang / phur bu dang / mig dmar dang / sgra gcan dang; mjug ring dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa bsangs dang / gza' lhag pa dang / spen pa dang / phur bu dang / mig dmar dang / sgra gcan dang; mjug ring dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Rāhu, Ketu, the sun, and the moon.

original: 'di dag dang / rgyu skar 'jig rten du 'dzom pa bshad cing ji ltar nyin mtshan ring ba yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag dang / rgyu skar 'jig rten du 'dzom pa bshad cing ji ltar nyin mtshan ring ba yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: The conjunctions of the nakṣatras with the planets, and the length of the days and nights, should be explained.

original: de la dgun @398a *//
analyzed: de la dgun @398a *//
translated: In the second month of winter,

original: gyi zla ba gnyis pa'i tshes brgyad la /
analyzed: gyi zla ba gnyis pa'i tshes brgyad la /
translated: on the eighth day of the month,

original: rgyu skar snar ma nyin mo la yud tsam bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu skar snar ma nyin mo la yud tsam bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: the nakṣatra Aśvinī rises at noon.

original: mtshan mo la yud tsam bco brgyad do //🔽sos ga'i zla ba tha ma'i tshes brgyad la rgyu skar ni snar ma'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo la yud tsam bco brgyad do // sos ga'i zla ba tha ma'i tshes brgyad la rgyu skar ni snar ma'o //
translated: At night, there are eighteen muhūrtas.

original: nyin mo la ni yud tsam bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin mo la ni yud tsam bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the last month of spring, on the eighth day of the month, the nakṣatra Aśvinī rises at noon.

original: mtshan mo la ni yud tsam bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: mtshan mo la ni yud tsam bcu gnyis so //
translated: At night, there are twelve muhūrtas.

original: dbyar gyi zla ba tha ma'i tshes brgyad la rgyu skar ni snar ma'o; ;nyin mo la ni yud tsam bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi zla ba tha ma'i tshes brgyad la rgyu skar ni snar ma'o; ;nyin mo la ni yud tsam bcu bzhi'o //
translated: In the last month of summer, on the eighth day of the month, the nakṣatra Aśvinī rises at noon.🔽At night, there are fourteen muhūrtas.

original: mtshan mo la ni yud tsam bcu drug go /
analyzed: mtshan mo la ni yud tsam bcu drug go /
translated: In the night, there are sixteen muhūrtas.

original: kye tre shang ku /🔽nyin par rnams nyin par dang / phyi de nyin par rjes su 'gro ba yin nam /
analyzed: kye tre shang ku / nyin par rnams nyin par dang / phyi de nyin par rjes su 'gro ba yin nam /
translated: O Trepiṭaka,🔽do the days follow the days,

original: ci yar ngo dang; mar ngo rjes su 'gro ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci yar ngo dang; mar ngo rjes su 'gro ba yin nam /
translated: or do the bright and dark fortnights follow each other?

original: ci lo rnams dgun zla tha chung gis 'phel ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci lo rnams dgun zla tha chung gis 'phel ba yin nam /
translated: Do the months increase in the last winter month?

original: ci dus rnams dbyar zla ra bas 'phel ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci dus rnams dbyar zla ra bas 'phel ba yin nam /
translated: Do the seasons increase in the first summer month?

original: kye tre shang kun /
analyzed: kye tre shang kun /
translated: O Trepiṭaka,

original: skad cig ma rnams kyi tshad grub pa ji lta bu yud tsam rnams kyi ni ji lta ba yin /
analyzed: skad cig ma rnams kyi tshad grub pa ji lta bu yud tsam rnams kyi ni ji lta ba yin /
translated: how is the measure of moments established, and how is that of muhūrtas?

original: kye padma'i snying po /
analyzed: kye padma'i snying po /
translated: O Lotus-born,

original: bud med ras bal 'khal ba 'da' ba shin tu ring ba dang / thung bar 'dren pa ma yin pa de lta bu ni de nyid de'i skad cig ma de'i tshad do //🔽de'i skad cig ma nyi shu rtsa drug la skad cig gcig /
analyzed: bud med ras bal 'khal ba 'da' ba shin tu ring ba dang / thung bar 'dren pa ma yin pa de lta bu ni de nyid de'i skad cig ma de'i tshad do // de'i skad cig ma nyi shu rtsa drug la skad cig gcig /
translated: the measure of that moment is just that time taken by a woman spinning cotton, which is neither too long nor too short.🔽Twenty-six of those moments make one instant.

original: skad cig drug la ni thang cig gcig go /
analyzed: skad cig drug la ni thang cig gcig go /
translated: Six instants make one second.

original: thang cig gsum la ni yud tsam gcig go /
analyzed: thang cig gsum la ni yud tsam gcig go /
translated: Three seconds make one muhūrta.

original: de lta bu'i rim pas rjes su 'brel pa'i yud tsam sum cu la ni nyin zhag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pas rjes su 'brel pa'i yud tsam sum cu la ni nyin zhag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Thirty of these moments make one day and night.

original: yud tsam de dag la 'di lta bu'i ming du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yud tsam de dag la 'di lta bu'i ming du 'gyur te /
translated: The moments are named as follows:

original: nyi ma shar ba na skyes bu drug cu rtsa dgu'i grim ma @398b 'jal ba ni 'thon po bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma shar ba na skyes bu drug cu rtsa dgu'i grim ma @398b 'jal ba ni 'thon po bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun rises, the time it takes for the shadow of a gung thang to move one gnya’ is called the fourth part.

original: skyes bu drug cus gzhal ba'i grib ma ni dkar po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //🔽skyes bu bcu gnyis kyis gzhal ba'i grib ma'i yun la yang dag par 'phel ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //🔽skyes bu drag gis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun la ston zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu drug cus gzhal ba'i grib ma ni dkar po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro // skyes bu bcu gnyis kyis gzhal ba'i grib ma'i yun la yang dag par 'phel ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro // skyes bu drag gis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun la ston zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The time it takes for the shadow of a man to move one gnya’ is called the white part.🔽The time it takes for the shadow of a man to move one gnya’ is called the increasing part.🔽The time it takes for the shadow of a man to move one gnya’ is called the autumn part.

original: skyes bu lnga yis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun la mngon par 'phel ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu lnga yis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun la mngon par 'phel ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The time it takes for the shadow of a man to move one gnya’ is called the increasing part.

original: skyes bu bzhi yis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun la gang gsum zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu bzhi yis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun la gang gsum zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The time of the shadow of four men is called the moment of Gangeṣu.

original: skyes bu gsum gyis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun la bzhin legs zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gsum gyis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun la bzhin legs zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The time of the shadow of three men is called the moment of Sumukha.

original: nyi ma gung na gnas pa ni gang gi rdo rje zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro; ;de'i rjes la ni srin po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma gung na gnas pa ni gang gi rdo rje zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro; ;de'i rjes la ni srin po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At noon, the time of the shadow of one man is called the moment of Vajra. After that, the time of the shadow of one man is called the moment of Rākṣasa.

original: dbus nas cung zhig yol ba skyes bu gcig gis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni ro hi ta zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbus nas cung zhig yol ba skyes bu gcig gis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni ro hi ta zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The time of the shadow of one man, when it is a little past noon, is called the moment of Rohi.

original: skyes bu bzhi yis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni stobs zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu bzhi yis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni stobs zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The time of the shadow of four men is called the moment of Bala.

original: skyes bu lngas bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro; ;skyes bu drug gis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni ro thams cad pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu lngas bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro; ;skyes bu drug gis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni ro thams cad pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The duration of a shadow measured by five people is called a vijaya muhūrta. The duration of a shadow measured by six people is called a sarvaroma muhūrta.

original: skyes bu bcu gnyis kyis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni nor zhes bya ba'i yud @399a *//🔽tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu bcu gnyis kyis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni nor zhes bya ba'i yud @399a *// tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The duration of a shadow measured by twelve people is called a dhana muhūrta.

original: skyes bu brgyad kyis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni blta na sdug ces bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu brgyad kyis bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni blta na sdug ces bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The duration of a shadow measured by eight people is called a darśana muhūrta.

original: skyes bu drug cu rtsa dgus bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni gzhan 'jigs zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu drug cu rtsa dgus bcal ba'i grib ma'i yun ni gzhan 'jigs zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The duration of a shadow measured by sixty-nine people is called a paribhāva muhūrta.

original: de dag ni nyi ma nub par rtsom pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nyi ma nub par rtsom pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: These are called the muhūrtas when the sun begins to set.

original: de dang nyin mo rnams kyi yud tsam yin no //
analyzed: de dang nyin mo rnams kyi yud tsam yin no //
translated: These are the muhūrtas of the day.

original: kye padma'i snying po /
analyzed: kye padma'i snying po /
translated: “O Padmagarbha,

original: mtshan mo rnams kyi yud tsam bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan mo rnams kyi yud tsam bshad par bya ste /
translated: I will explain the muhūrtas of the night.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: nyi ma nub pa ni drang po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa ni drang po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The setting of the sun is called the moment of honesty.

original: de'i rjes la ni skar ma rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //🔽de nas yang dag zung zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de'i rjes la ni skar ma rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro // de nas yang dag zung zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: After that, it is called the moment of the movement of the stars.🔽Then it is the moment called the right pair.

original: de nas da ltar zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de nas da ltar zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: Then it is the moment called the present.

original: de nas mtha' med ces bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de nas mtha' med ces bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: Then it is the moment called the endless.

original: de nas bong bu zhes bya pa'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bong bu zhes bya pa'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it is the moment called the donkey.

original: de nas srid mo zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de nas srid mo zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: Then it is the moment called the sister.

original: nam gyi gung la gnas pa na ni cha shas zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: nam gyi gung la gnas pa na ni cha shas zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: When it is midnight, it is the moment called the part.

analyzed: nam gyi gung 'das pa na bram ze zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: After midnight, it is the moment called the brahmin.

original: de nas nyis skyed ces bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de nas nyis skyed ces bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: Then it is the moment called the double.

original: de nas ma rga zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de nas ma rga zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: Then it is the moment called the old.

original: de nas mun 'jigs zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de nas mun 'jigs zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: Then it is the moment called the fear of darkness.

original: de nas ma zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de nas ma zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: Then it is the moment called the mother.

original: de nas nyi ma'i gdung ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma'i gdung ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //
translated: Then there is the moment called “sun’s heat.”

original: de nas byi bzhin zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo //🔽padma'i snying po /
analyzed: de nas byi bzhin zhes bya ba'i yud tsam mo // padma'i snying po /
translated: Then there is the moment called “mouse.”

original: yud tsam sum cu po de dag ni nyin zhag yin @399b par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yud tsam sum cu po de dag ni nyin zhag yin @399b par shes par bya'o //
translated: The thirty moments are a day.

original: de yi skad cig thang cig yud tsam ni //
analyzed: de yi skad cig thang cig yud tsam ni //
translated: A moment, a second, and a day

original: yud tsam sum cu'i cha mchog thang gcig go /
analyzed: yud tsam sum cu'i cha mchog thang gcig go /
translated: are the best part of thirty moments.

original: thang cig cham chog drug che skad cig go /
analyzed: thang cig cham chog drug che skad cig go /

analyzed: skad cig nyi shu brgya cha de skad cig /

analyzed: ji ltar bud med ring thung gis //
translated: Just as a woman’s finger snap

original: ras bal 'da' ba 'dren spangs pa //
analyzed: ras bal 'da' ba 'dren spangs pa //
translated: is the passing of a cotton thread.

original: 'dir de skad cig ring po ste //
analyzed: 'dir de skad cig ring po ste //
translated: Here that is a long moment.

original: de yi skad cig brgya nyi shu //
analyzed: de yi skad cig brgya nyi shu //
translated: One hundred and twenty of those

original: skad cig gcig de drug thang cig /
analyzed: skad cig gcig de drug thang cig /
translated: is one second.

original: thang cig sum cu yud tsam gcig /
analyzed: thang cig sum cu yud tsam gcig /
translated: Thirty of those is one minute.

original: de lta bu yi spyor ba yis //🔽yud tsam sum cu nyin zhag gcig /
analyzed: de lta bu yi spyor ba yis // yud tsam sum cu nyin zhag gcig /
translated: By this practice🔽thirty of those is one day.

original: nyin zhag sum cu zla gcig ste /
analyzed: nyin zhag sum cu zla gcig ste /
translated: Thirty of those is one month.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis lo gcig go /
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis lo gcig go /
translated: Twelve of those is one year.

original: bzhi mthong dkar dang 'jam bcas dang // nyi skyes bzhin legs spong byed dang // ro hi stobs ldan rnam rgyal dang // thams cad ro pa nor dang ni //
analyzed: bzhi mthong dkar dang 'jam bcas dang // nyi skyes bzhin legs spong byed dang // ro hi stobs ldan rnam rgyal dang // thams cad ro pa nor dang ni //
translated: the Rohita, the powerful, the victorious, the all-tasting, the wealthy,

original: mnan da ra dang gzhan 'jigs dang // drag po dang ni skar ma spyod //
analyzed: mnan da ra dang gzhan 'jigs dang // drag po dang ni skar ma spyod //
translated: the Mandara, the other-frightening, the fierce, and the star-practitioner,🔽the well-grasping, the present, the infinite, the donkey, the rakshasa, the part-brahmin,🔽the self-born, the arjuna, the fearful, the one tormented by fire and sun,

original: yang dag gzung dang da ltar dang // mtha' yas dang ni bong bu dang // srin po cha shas bram ze dang // nyid skyes aarga man 'jigs dang // me dang nyi mas gdungs pa dang // byi bzhin zhes ni bya ba rnams //
analyzed: yang dag gzung dang da ltar dang // mtha' yas dang ni bong bu dang // srin po cha shas bram ze dang // nyid skyes aarga man 'jigs dang // me dang nyi mas gdungs pa dang // byi bzhin zhes ni bya ba rnams //
translated: and the one called the mouse.

original: yud tsam rnams kyi ming yin no //
analyzed: yud tsam rnams kyi ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of the muhurtas.

original: yang bram ze /
analyzed: yang bram ze /
translated: Again, brahmin,

original: dus rnams kyi 'byung ba bshad par bya yi nyon cig /
analyzed: dus rnams kyi 'byung ba bshad par bya yi nyon cig /
translated: I will explain the origin of the times. Listen!

original: dus rnams ji ltar 'gyur ba yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dus rnams ji ltar 'gyur ba yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: I will also describe how the times change.

original: mig 'byed 'dzum gnyis la thang cig gcig go /
analyzed: mig 'byed 'dzum gnyis la thang cig gcig go /
translated: Two eye-openings and closings are one kshana.

original: thang cig bzhi la mchog dka' gcig go /
analyzed: thang cig bzhi la mchog dka' gcig go /
translated: Four kshanas are one lava.

original: mchog dka' bcu drug la ni dus tshod gcig go /
analyzed: mchog dka' bcu drug la ni dus tshod gcig go /
translated: Sixteen lavas are one nimesha.

original: dus tshod sum cu la chu tshod gcig go /
analyzed: dus tshod sum cu la chu tshod gcig go /
translated: Thirty of these are one hour.

original: de la chu tshod gnyis la ni yud tsam gcig @400a *//
analyzed: de la chu tshod gnyis la ni yud tsam gcig @400a *//
translated: Two of these are one period.

original: go; yud tsam gcig gi tshad ci tsam zhe na /
analyzed: go; yud tsam gcig gi tshad ci tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of one period?

original: chu srang brgya bum par blugs nas 'dzag pa'i tshad do //
analyzed: chu srang brgya bum par blugs nas 'dzag pa'i tshad do //
translated: One hundred kumbhās of water are poured into a vessel and the time it takes to drain is one period.

original: chu tshod kyi bum pa'i tshad ci tsam zhe na /
analyzed: chu tshod kyi bum pa'i tshad ci tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of a kumbhā?

original: 'ol ma se gcig gis gser sor bzhi bsnyad de /
analyzed: 'ol ma se gcig gis gser sor bzhi bsnyad de /
translated: One kumbhā is four sers of gold.

original: phyogs bzhi nas mnyam par bzlums pa'i tshad kyi bum pa'i zhabs su brtol nas /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi nas mnyam par bzlums pa'i tshad kyi bum pa'i zhabs su brtol nas /
translated: A vessel is made with four sides that are equal in size.

original: chu zad pa de nyi chu tshod gcig gi tshad do //
analyzed: chu zad pa de nyi chu tshod gcig gi tshad do //
translated: The time it takes for the water to drain from the bottom of the vessel is one hour.

original: chu tshod gnyis ni yud tsam gcig go /
analyzed: chu tshod gnyis ni yud tsam gcig go /
translated: Two hours are one period.

original: bram ze / de lta bu'i yud tsam sum cu la ni zhag gcig tu 'dod do //🔽mig 'byed 'dzum bcu drug ni mchog dka'o //
analyzed: bram ze / de lta bu'i yud tsam sum cu la ni zhag gcig tu 'dod do // mig 'byed 'dzum bcu drug ni mchog dka'o //
translated: Brahmin, thirty of these periods are considered one day.🔽Sixteen eye blinks is one muhūrta.

original: mchog dka' bcu drug la ni dus tshod gcig go /
analyzed: mchog dka' bcu drug la ni dus tshod gcig go /
translated: Sixteen muhūrtas is one day and night.

original: dus tshod drug cu rtsa bzhi la ni yud tsam gcig go /
analyzed: dus tshod drug cu rtsa bzhi la ni yud tsam gcig go /
translated: Sixty-four of these is one period.

original: yud tsam sum cu la nyin zhag gcig go /
analyzed: yud tsam sum cu la nyin zhag gcig go /
translated: Thirty of these is one day and night.

original: nyin zhag sum cu la zla ba gcig go /
analyzed: nyin zhag sum cu la zla ba gcig go /
translated: Thirty of those days and nights make one month.🔽Twelve of those months make one year.

translated: The city which is well begun in the Mrigashira lunar mansion will be righteous, and the people will be victorious over their senses by virtue of their morality and contentment with their own wives. analyzed: mon gru la nges par brtsams pa'i grong khyer ni de dag rig pa dang mi ldan zhing g-yo la dga' zhing bud med dang / btung ba dang ldan zhing phyis ni chu yis 'jig par 'gyur ro //

original: bra nye la nges par brtsams pa'i grong khyer ni rtsod pa la dga' zhing skal ba chung la tshul khrims nyams shing sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i skye bo ma dul ba gnas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rgyu skar de rnams dang / gza' sgra gcan du ldan pas 'bras bu smin par bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain the ripening of the fruits by the conjunction of those lunar mansions with the planet Rāhu.

original: kye padma'i snying po /
analyzed: kye padma'i snying po /
translated: O Padmagarbha,

original: smin drug dang gza' sgra gcan du ldan pas ni yul ka ling ka dang / ma ga dhe pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smin drug dang gza' sgra gcan du ldan pas ni yul ka ling ka dang / ma ga dhe pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: by the conjunction of Aśvinī with the planet Rāhu, there will be a great plague in the land of Kāliṅga and Magadha.

original: gang gi tshe snar ma dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni skye @408b dgu rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe snar ma dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni skye @408b dgu rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When [the moon] is joined to Puṣya and Rāhu, it brings illness to the people.

original: gang gi tshe mgo dang gza' sgra gcan du ldan pas ni lus 'phags pa rnams dang / rgyal po'i zham 'bring pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mgo dang gza' sgra gcan du ldan pas ni lus 'phags pa rnams dang / rgyal po'i zham 'bring pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When [the moon] is joined to Mṛgaśiras and Rāhu, it brings illness to the people of Videha and the king’s retinue.

original: de bzhin du lag dang / nam so dang / rgyal dang / skag dang / gang gi tshe sgra gcan du ldan pas ni klu rnams dang / gangs can pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lag dang / nam so dang / rgyal dang / skag dang / gang gi tshe sgra gcan du ldan pas ni klu rnams dang / gangs can pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, when [the moon] is joined to Hasta, Citrā, Svāti, Viśākhā, and Rāhu, it brings illness to the nāgas and the people of the snowy regions.

original: gang gi tshe mchu dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni shar phyogs pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mchu dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni shar phyogs pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When [the moon] is joined to Āśleṣā and Rāhu, it brings illness to the people of the east.

original: gang gi tshe gre dang gza' sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rkun ma'i gnas nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gre dang gza' sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rkun ma'i gnas nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When [the moon] is joined to Maghā and Rāhu, it brings the occurrence of thieves.

original: gang gi tshe dbo dang gza' sgra gcan du ldan pas ni aa ba na ti ba rnams la nad nye bar 'byung ngo //🔽gang gi tshe me bzhi dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni yul 'khor ba rnams la nad nye bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbo dang gza' sgra gcan du ldan pas ni aa ba na ti ba rnams la nad nye bar 'byung ngo // gang gi tshe me bzhi dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni yul 'khor ba rnams la nad nye bar 'byung ngo //
translated: When Mars and Rāhu are together, there is an outbreak of disease among the Avāntī people.🔽When Mercury and Rāhu are together, there is an outbreak of disease among the people of the country.

original: gang gi tshe nag pa dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni bya dang rkang gnyis pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nag pa dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni bya dang rkang gnyis pa rnams la nad nye bar 'byung ngo //
translated: When Saturn and Rāhu are together, there is an outbreak of disease among birds and two-legged creatures.

original: gang gi tshe sa ri dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rab tu byung ba thams cad la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sa ri dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rab tu byung ba thams cad la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: When Jupiter and Rāhu are together, there is an outbreak of disease among all the renunciants.

original: gang gi tshe sa ga dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni chu'i sems can rnams la nad 'byung ngo //🔽gang gi tshe lha mtshams dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni zong dang ldan pa'i tshong pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sa ga dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni chu'i sems can rnams la nad 'byung ngo // gang gi tshe lha mtshams dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni zong dang ldan pa'i tshong pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: When Venus and Rāhu are together, there is an outbreak of disease among the water creatures.🔽When Ketu and Rāhu are together, there is an outbreak of disease among the merchants.

original: gang gi tshe snron dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni sgo srung rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe snron dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni sgo srung rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: When the lunar mansion Āśleṣā and Rāhu are together, there is an outbreak of disease among the gatekeepers.

original: gang gi tshe snrubs dang @409a *//
analyzed: gang gi tshe snrubs dang @409a *//
translated: When Śravaṇa and Rāhu are together,

original: sgra gcan du ldan pas ni 'dron po rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgra gcan du ldan pas ni 'dron po rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: there will be disease for travelers.🔽When Uttarā and Rāhu are together,

original: gang gi tshe chu stod dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni aa ban ti pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chu stod dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni aa ban ti pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: there will be disease for the Avantin people.🔽When Dhaniṣṭhā and Rāhu are together,

original: gang gi tshe chu smad dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni kam po tse'i gling pa rnams dang / na ba ti pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chu smad dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni kam po tse'i gling pa rnams dang / na ba ti pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: there will be disease for the people of Kaṃboja and Nābhi.🔽When Śatabhiṣā and Rāhu are together,

original: gang gi tshe byi bzhin dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni lho phyogs pa thams cad dang / zangs gling pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byi bzhin dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni lho phyogs pa thams cad dang / zangs gling pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: there will be disease for all the southern people and the people of Tāmradvīpa.🔽When Pūrvābhādrapadā and Rāhu are together,

original: gang gi tshe gro bzhin sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rkun ma la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gro bzhin sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rkun ma la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: there will be disease for thieves.🔽When Uttarābhādrapadā and Rāhu are together,

original: gang gi tshe mon gre dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni ku ru pa dang; rna can pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mon gre dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni ku ru pa dang; rna can pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: there will be disease for the people of Kurukṣetra and Karṇāṭa.

original: gang gi tshe mon gru dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni gser 'tshong ba rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mon gru dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni gser 'tshong ba rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: When Mṛgaśiras is joined to Rāhu, there will be illness for the goldsmiths.

original: gang gi tshe khrums smad dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rol mo ba rnams la nad 'byung ngo //🔽gang gi tshe nam gru dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni gru pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe khrums smad dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rol mo ba rnams la nad 'byung ngo // gang gi tshe nam gru dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni gru pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: When Āśleṣā is joined to Rāhu, there will be illness for the musicians.🔽When Maghā is joined to Rāhu, there will be illness for the sailors.

original: gang gi tshe tha skar dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rta 'tshong pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tha skar dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni rta 'tshong pa rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: When Pūrvāphālgunī is joined to Rāhu, there will be illness for the horse dealers.

original: gang gi tshe bra nye dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni zhing bzang po rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bra nye dang sgra gcan du ldan pas ni zhing bzang po rnams la nad 'byung ngo //
translated: When Uttarāphālgunī is joined to Rāhu, there will be illness for the good farmers.

original: kye padma'i snying po /
analyzed: kye padma'i snying po /
translated: “O Padmagarbha,

original: 'di dag ni gza' sgra gcan dang ldan pas 'bras bu rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i le'u'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gza' sgra gcan dang ldan pas 'bras bu rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i le'u'o //
translated: this is the chapter on the results of the conjunction of the planet Rāhu.

original: rgyu skar so so'i las kyi dgos pa bshad pa khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu skar so so'i las kyi dgos pa bshad pa khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The specific functions of the lunar mansions should be understood.

original: rgyu skar gang gis las gang yin pa'i drang srong rnams ni 'di ltar 'dod @409b do; ;smin drug ni skar ma drug yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu skar gang gis las gang yin pa'i drang srong rnams ni 'di ltar 'dod @409b do; ;smin drug ni skar ma drug yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that the lunar mansion Pürvâṣāḍhā is six stars.

original: de la ni me'i bya ba bya ste /
analyzed: de la ni me'i bya ba bya ste /
translated: In it, one should do fire-related work,

original: me lha mnyes par bya ba dang / sbyin sreg byas na 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me lha mnyes par bya ba dang / sbyin sreg byas na 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: please the fire god, and perform fire offerings.

original: de la ba lang gi gnas bya zhing zho dkrogs na mar che la /
analyzed: de la ba lang gi gnas bya zhing zho dkrogs na mar che la /
translated: In it, one should do the work of a cow pen, churn milk, and get a lot of butter.

original: ra dang / lug nyo bar bya zhing ba glang dgye bar bya'o //
analyzed: ra dang / lug nyo bar bya zhing ba glang dgye bar bya'o //
translated: In it, one should buy goats and sheep, and let out cows.🔽In it, one should melt iron, make all kinds of vessels, keep jewels, do work, keep weapons, make inner rooms, and light fires in the house.

original: lcags bzhu ba dang / snod thams cad bya ba dang / rin po che bcang ba dang / las kyi mtha' bya ba dang / mtshon bcang ba dang / nang khang dang / khyim du me sbar ba dang / me tog ser po dang / dmar po'i sa bon gdab pa dang /
analyzed: lcags bzhu ba dang / snod thams cad bya ba dang / rin po che bcang ba dang / las kyi mtha' bya ba dang / mtshon bcang ba dang / nang khang dang / khyim du me sbar ba dang / me tog ser po dang / dmar po'i sa bon gdab pa dang /
translated: In it, one should plant yellow and red flowers,

original: khyim byas pa la der 'dug par bsgrub pa dang / gos sar pa bgo bar bya zhing rin gyis ni nyo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim byas pa la der 'dug par bsgrub pa dang / gos sar pa bgo bar bya zhing rin gyis ni nyo bar mi bya'o //
translated: and one should make a house and live there. One should wear new clothes, but not buy them with money.

original: las drag po bsgrub pa g-yul 'gyed pa dang / bcing ba rnams la bzang zhing mkhas pas pha rol dang rtsod pa'i sbyor ba ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: las drag po bsgrub pa g-yul 'gyed pa dang / bcing ba rnams la bzang zhing mkhas pas pha rol dang rtsod pa'i sbyor ba ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not engage in disputes with others, except for the performance of fierce rites, such as going to war or binding.

original: spu gri bya ba dang / bca' ba thams cad bya zhing me dang ldan pa'i snod der bya zhing tshe spel ba dang / skra bkru ba dang / bud med rnams la sgeg pa dang / nyi ma de la char pa bab na dgra ldang zhing khro ba dang /
analyzed: spu gri bya ba dang / bca' ba thams cad bya zhing me dang ldan pa'i snod der bya zhing tshe spel ba dang / skra bkru ba dang / bud med rnams la sgeg pa dang / nyi ma de la char pa bab na dgra ldang zhing khro ba dang /
translated: One should perform all the rites of a razor and all the rites of a fire vessel. One should perform the rites of increasing life, washing the hair, and adorning women. If it rains on that day, one should engage in fierce rites, such as causing enemies to rise up and become angry.

original: dga' ba dang / drag po'i las brtsams zhing rkun ma 'gyed pa bzang zhing de la skyes pa tshe ring ba dang / grags pa dang ldan pa dang / mchod spyin byed cing tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / drag po'i las brtsams zhing rkun ma 'gyed pa bzang zhing de la skyes pa tshe ring ba dang / grags pa dang ldan pa dang / mchod spyin byed cing tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: One should undertake fierce rites and send out thieves. It is good to do so. On that day, men will have long lives, be famous, perform sacrifices, and be endowed with moral discipline.

original: de dag ni smin drug la bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni smin drug la bya'o //
translated: These are the rites to be performed in Mṛgaśirā.

original: snar ma la ni sa gzhi la zhing las thams cad bya ba dang / zhing dang / dngos po dang / gtsug lag khang @410a *//
analyzed: snar ma la ni sa gzhi la zhing las thams cad bya ba dang / zhing dang / dngos po dang / gtsug lag khang @410a *//
translated: In Āśleṣā, one should perform all the rites of the field on the ground, such as rites for the field, rites for the house, and rites for the temple.

original: dang; khyim gsar bya ba dang / bdag nyid kyi drag shul bya dgos pa rnams dang / phyugs kyi gnas dang / sa bon thams cad gdab pa dang / gos bgo bar bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: dang; khyim gsar bya ba dang / bdag nyid kyi drag shul bya dgos pa rnams dang / phyugs kyi gnas dang / sa bon thams cad gdab pa dang / gos bgo bar bya bar bstan to //
translated: the establishment of a cattle pen, the sowing of all seeds, and the wearing of clothes.

original: bu lon brdar mi rung ste /
analyzed: bu lon brdar mi rung ste /
translated: “One should not settle a debt.

original: dgra 'phel ba dang / ston mo dang / chang gi sbyor ba gnyis spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgra 'phel ba dang / ston mo dang / chang gi sbyor ba gnyis spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should avoid two things: increasing one’s enemies and parties and drinking alcohol.

original: nyin par de la bab nas gang skyes kyang bkra shis shing snying rje dang / bzod pa ldan zhing bud med dga' ba dang / zas la brkam pa dang / tshe ring zhing phyugs mang la nor dang / 'bru mang zhing longs spyod che zhing de la rgyal bar 'gyur te; snar ma la bya'o //
analyzed: nyin par de la bab nas gang skyes kyang bkra shis shing snying rje dang / bzod pa ldan zhing bud med dga' ba dang / zas la brkam pa dang / tshe ring zhing phyugs mang la nor dang / 'bru mang zhing longs spyod che zhing de la rgyal bar 'gyur te; snar ma la bya'o //
translated: “If the sun enters Puṣya, whatever is undertaken will be auspicious. One will be compassionate, patient, and loved by women. One will be greedy for food, have a long life, many cattle, much wealth and grain, and great enjoyments. One will be victorious. This is for Puṣya.

original: zla ba dang mgor ldan pa la rig pa tshegs chung dus khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dal ba'i las thams cad bya ste /
analyzed: zla ba dang mgor ldan pa la rig pa tshegs chung dus khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dal ba'i las thams cad bya ste /
translated: “If the moon is in Āśleṣā, one will obtain knowledge with little difficulty. One should perform all slow rites.

original: las gang snar ma la bya bar bstan pa de dag thams cad la bya'o //
analyzed: las gang snar ma la bya bar bstan pa de dag thams cad la bya'o //
translated: Whatever acts are taught to be done under Ashlesha should all be done under [these nakṣatras].

original: 'o ma dang ldan pa'i shing las bzho ba dang / 'o ma can gyi sa bon gdab pa dang / rgyal po rgyal sar 'jug pa dang / gnas kyi don du 'gro ba dang / rta dang / glang po dang / ba lang gdul ba la mchog tu bzang ngo //
analyzed: 'o ma dang ldan pa'i shing las bzho ba dang / 'o ma can gyi sa bon gdab pa dang / rgyal po rgyal sar 'jug pa dang / gnas kyi don du 'gro ba dang / rta dang / glang po dang / ba lang gdul ba la mchog tu bzang ngo //
translated: [They are] excellent for milking a tree that has milk, planting seeds that have milk, a king's enthronement, going for the sake of a place, taming horses, elephants, and oxen.

original: gos sar ba bgo ba dang / rgyan gyis brgyan par mi bya zhing bram ze rnams kyi las thams cad de la bya bar rung ngo //
analyzed: gos sar ba bgo ba dang / rgyan gyis brgyan par mi bya zhing bram ze rnams kyi las thams cad de la bya bar rung ngo //
translated: One should not wear new clothes, adorn oneself with ornaments, or do all the rites of the brahmins under that [nakṣatra].

original: nyi ma de la char bab pa de ni legs par bab par bstan to //
analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab pa de ni legs par bab par bstan to //
translated: Rain that falls on that day is taught to be well-fallen.

original: nyi ma de la skyes pa gnyid che zhing yid g-yengs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyi ma de la skyes pa gnyid che zhing yid g-yengs par 'gyur te /
translated: One born on that day will have much sleep and a distracted mind.

original: mgo'i yin par @410b bstan to //
analyzed: mgo'i yin par @410b bstan to //
translated: It is taught to be [the nakṣatra] of the head.

original: lag la ni don gnyer ba dang / las bzang po bya ba dang / drag po'i las rnams 'grub pas mkhas pas 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: lag la ni don gnyer ba dang / las bzang po bya ba dang / drag po'i las rnams 'grub pas mkhas pas 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Since [the nakṣatra] Hasta is for the sake of wealth, doing good deeds, and accomplishing violent acts, the wise should strive [under it].

original: khron pa dang / 'obs dang / rdzing bu de la bya bar bzang ngo //
analyzed: khron pa dang / 'obs dang / rdzing bu de la bya bar bzang ngo //
translated: a well, a moat, or a pond.

original: ba thul ma gsar ma nyo na 'grub /
analyzed: ba thul ma gsar ma nyo na 'grub /
translated: If one buys a new garment, it will be successful.

original: mar khu btsir ba'i las dang / chang btsong ba dang / bur shing gi sa bon gzugs pa dang / nyi ma de la char pa bab na char mang du 'bab par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mar khu btsir ba'i las dang / chang btsong ba dang / bur shing gi sa bon gzugs pa dang / nyi ma de la char pa bab na char mang du 'bab par shes par bya'o //
translated: If one presses oil, sells liquor, plants sugarcane, or if it rains on that day, one should know that there will be much rain.

original: nyi ma de la skyes pa khro zhing ri dvags kyi rngon pa byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyi ma de la skyes pa khro zhing ri dvags kyi rngon pa byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If a man is angry on that day, he will become a hunter.

original: lag la bya'o //
analyzed: lag la bya'o //
translated: One should do it with the hand.

original: nam so la ni kha dog bcang bar bya ba dang / ba lang spyin pa dang / gtsug phud bzhag pa la rung zhing sngags thams cad 'grub bo //
analyzed: nam so la ni kha dog bcang bar bya ba dang / ba lang spyin pa dang / gtsug phud bzhag pa la rung zhing sngags thams cad 'grub bo //
translated: If it is a new moon day, it is suitable for applying color, giving a cow, or shaving the head, and all mantras will be successful.

original: bu don du gnyer bar chung ma blang ba dang / yang dang / yang du bya bar 'dod pa'i las de rnams bya bar bzang ste /
analyzed: bu don du gnyer bar chung ma blang ba dang / yang dang / yang du bya bar 'dod pa'i las de rnams bya bar bzang ste /
translated: If one desires a son, it is good to take a wife, and one should do those deeds again and again.

original: gal te 'chi ba'i dogs pa yod pas g-yo ba'i las mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'chi ba'i dogs pa yod pas g-yo ba'i las mi bya'o //
translated: If there is a fear of death, one should not do moving deeds.

original: nyin zhag de la skyes pa mchog tu shis shing 'dod pa chung la bud med kyi chags pa skyes bu de che zhing sna tshogs pa shes shing gcig la mi 'jug par bstan te /
analyzed: nyin zhag de la skyes pa mchog tu shis shing 'dod pa chung la bud med kyi chags pa skyes bu de che zhing sna tshogs pa shes shing gcig la mi 'jug par bstan te /
translated: The day is the best for men, for those who desire little, for women, for the increase of passion, for the knowledge of various things, and for not engaging in one thing.

original: nam so la bya'o //
analyzed: nam so la bya'o //
translated: The night is for the performance of all actions.

original: rgyal la ni bsod nams dang / grags pa dang / tshe bsring ba dang / mchod pa rtag tu bya bar bzang ngo //
analyzed: rgyal la ni bsod nams dang / grags pa dang / tshe bsring ba dang / mchod pa rtag tu bya bar bzang ngo //
translated: The day is good for always performing meritorious, famous, life-prolonging, and worshipful actions.

original: bram ze'i las thams cad bya bar rung zhing rgyal po dang / blon po gzhug pa dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / dul ba spyad pa dang / rgyal po dbang bskur ba dang / rang gi @411a *//
analyzed: bram ze'i las thams cad bya bar rung zhing rgyal po dang / blon po gzhug pa dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / dul ba spyad pa dang / rgyal po dbang bskur ba dang / rang gi @411a *//
translated: All the actions of Brahmins are suitable, such as engaging kings and ministers, serving gurus, practicing self-control, consecrating kings, and adorning one's own

original: bu la rgyan gdags pa dang / kha spu bregs pa'i bya ba rnams de la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: bu la rgyan gdags pa dang / kha spu bregs pa'i bya ba rnams de la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: children. One should be skilled in those actions.

original: mdun na 'don bsko ba dang // rgyal mtshan gzugs par bya'o /
analyzed: mdun na 'don bsko ba dang // rgyal mtshan gzugs par bya'o /
translated: One should appoint a chief minister and erect a victory banner.

original: nyi ma de la char pa bab pa ni kun tu gnod par 'bab cing rkun ma dang / nad med pas rtag tu bde bar 'gyur zhing rgyal la las thams cad bya bar rung ngo //
analyzed: nyi ma de la char pa bab pa ni kun tu gnod par 'bab cing rkun ma dang / nad med pas rtag tu bde bar 'gyur zhing rgyal la las thams cad bya bar rung ngo //
translated: diseases, and the king will be at peace, and all activities are suitable to be done.

original: dgra dang 'khon pa'i sbyor ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgra dang 'khon pa'i sbyor ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should avoid the combination of enemies and resentment.

original: de la skyes pa tshe ring ba dang / grags pa dang / longs spyod che bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la skyes pa tshe ring ba dang / grags pa dang / longs spyod che bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one is born on that day, one will have a long life, fame, and great wealth.

analyzed: rgyal la bya'o //

original: skag la bya'o //
analyzed: skag la bya'o //

analyzed: mchu la ni 'bru thams cad kyi sa bon bya ba dang / bsdu bar bya ba dang / sa bon gzugs pa dang / mdzod bya zhing 'bru rnams gzhug pa dang / pha'i bya ba dang / dad pas bya ba thams cad de la bya zhing /
translated: On the asterism Puṣya, all seeds should be sown, all collections gathered, all seeds planted, all treasuries filled, all grains stored, all paternal tasks performed, and all tasks done with faith.

original: nyi ma de la char bab pas ni /
analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab pas ni /
translated: If it rains on that day,

translated: One born on that day will have a long life, many children, great attachment to women, longing for food, and will go to the front of the battle and be victorious.

original: drag po'i las thams cad la mkhas pas de la spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: drag po'i las thams cad la mkhas pas de la spang bar bya'o //
translated: Since he is skilled in all violent actions, he should be avoided.

original: mchu la bya'o //
analyzed: mchu la bya'o //

analyzed: gre la ni dge ba dang / zhing pa'i las don du gnyer bar bya'o //
translated: On the asterism Aśvinī, one should undertake virtuous actions and the work of farmers.

analyzed: de la skyu ru ra la sogs pa 'bras bu khyad par mnyam pa rnams kyi las bya ba dang / gzhon pa rnams bkra shis kyi khrus bya ba dang / bag phebs par bya ba dang / gnas bya ba dang / skal ba dang ldan zhing nye bar 'tsho ba'i las rnams bya ba dang /
translated: In that [month], one should perform the rites of [planting] seeds, such as jujubes, and so forth, the rites of bathing and auspiciousness for the young, the rites of pacification, the rites of consecration, and the rites of good fortune and livelihood.

original: byis pa'i skra bkru ba dang / skra mdzes par bya ba dang / skal ba dang ldan pa'i las dang / nyi ma de la char bab pa legs par bab pa bstan te gre la'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i skra bkru ba dang / skra mdzes par bya ba dang / skal ba dang ldan pa'i las dang / nyi ma de la char bab pa legs par bab pa bstan te gre la'o //
translated: [One should] wash the hair of children, make the hair beautiful, perform the rites of good fortune, and show that the rain that falls on that day is well-fallen.

original: dbo la ni las thams cad bya ste /
analyzed: dbo la ni las thams cad bya ste /

original: khang pa rnying pa gso ba la sogs pa thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: khang pa rnying pa gso ba la sogs pa thams cad bya'o //
translated: All [rites], such as repairing old houses, and so forth, should be performed.

analyzed: de la skyes pa yid gzhungs pa dang / grags pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /

analyzed: gzhan yang / de la byin mi nyams shing thams cad brtan par bstan to //

original: de la char bab na ni thams cad phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la char bab na ni thams cad phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /

original: dbo la bya'o //
analyzed: dbo la bya'o //

analyzed: me bzhi la las phra ba thams cad byang zhing bram ze'i las thams cad bya bar bzang ngo //
translated: On the Mrigasiras, all subtle activities are purified and it is good for all the activities of Brahmins.

analyzed: glang po dang / glang po mchog zhon pa dang / rdzing bu bya ba dang / brkus na 'grub ste /
translated: One should commence riding elephants and the best of elephants, making ponds, and stealing.

analyzed: cing yun ring du 'tsho ste me bzhi la bya'o //

analyzed: lder so bya ba dang / bsrung ba dang / rol mo dang / zhal zhal dang / lag gi bzo rnams bya bar bzang ngo //

analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab pas sna tshogs kyi las 'grub par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that if it rains on that day, various actions are accomplished.

analyzed: tshe ring zhing bsod nams che la bud med la dga' bar 'gyur te /

original: nag pa'i bya'o //
analyzed: nag pa'i bya'o //

original: bag ma blang ba dang / bag ma btang ba dang / gnyen bya ba dang / gnas dang / grogs po dang / mal cha dang / khyim du 'jug pa la bzang ngo //
analyzed: bag ma blang ba dang / bag ma btang ba dang / gnyen bya ba dang / gnas dang / grogs po dang / mal cha dang / khyim du 'jug pa la bzang ngo //

analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab na rlung mi 'chad par ldang ngo //

original: khyim mi dbub ste /
analyzed: khyim mi dbub ste /
translated: nor should one dig a house.

original: byas na 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas na 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does, it will not be successful.

original: phyugs kyi gnas dang / de bzhin du grong dpon bsko ba dang / tshong dpon bsko ba dang; rgyal po'i dgos pa rnams de la bya bar bzang ngo //

translated: It is good to appoint a head of cattle, and likewise to appoint a head of the village, a head of the merchants, and to do the king’s business.
