analyzed: nyi ma de la skyes pa 'khor mang po'i ngang tshul can dang / byas pa gzo bar 'gyur ba dang / grogs po dang gcugs shing bsod nams dman zhing mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is born on that day will be of virtuous character, will have many followers, will be grateful, will be dear to friends, will have little merit, and will be wise.”

original: tsha bas btab pa mi sos shing brtan par bstan to //
analyzed: tsha bas btab pa mi sos shing brtan par bstan to //
translated: If it rains on that day, it is taught that the rain will be steady and refreshing.

original: nyi ma de la char bab pa legs par 'bab par bstan te /
analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab pa legs par 'bab par bstan te /
translated: If it rains on that day, it is taught that the rain will be good.

original: chu smad kyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: chu smad kyi bya ba'o //
translated: This concludes the activities of the second half of the month.

original: byi bzhin la tshangs pa'i lha'i mchod pa mi bya zhing /
analyzed: byi bzhin la tshangs pa'i lha'i mchod pa mi bya zhing /
translated: On Bhisha, one should not make offerings to the gods of the Brahmans.

original: gro bzhin la ni g-yul sprad par bya yi /
analyzed: gro bzhin la ni g-yul sprad par bya yi /
translated: On Shravana, one should engage in battle.

original: rol mo bslab pa dang / bklags pa rnams myur bar 'grub bo //
analyzed: rol mo bslab pa dang / bklags pa rnams myur bar 'grub bo //
translated: One will quickly accomplish the training in music and recitation.

original: rna cha gdags pa dang / @414a *//
analyzed: rna cha gdags pa dang / @414a *//
translated: One should wear earrings.

original: rgyal por dbang bskur ba dang / bram ze'i las thams cad de la bya zhing gtor ma gtong ba dang / dpung la lta bar bzang ngo //
analyzed: rgyal por dbang bskur ba dang / bram ze'i las thams cad de la bya zhing gtor ma gtong ba dang / dpung la lta bar bzang ngo //
translated: One should perform all the rites of the Brahmans, such as the consecration of a king, and offer oblations and examine the army.

original: de la skyes pa ni nad med pa dang; stobs dang ldan pa dang / mchog sbyin gyi ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la skyes pa ni nad med pa dang; stobs dang ldan pa dang / mchog sbyin gyi ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is born on that day, one will be healthy, strong, and generous.

original: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni legs par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni legs par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it rains on that day, the rain will be good.

original: de la gro bzhin dang zla bar 'dzom na stor ba phyir rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gro bzhin dang zla bar 'dzom na stor ba phyir rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: If Shravana and the moon are in conjunction on that day, one will recover what has been lost.

original: gro bzhin gyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gro bzhin gyi bya ba'o //
translated: This concludes the activities of Shravana.

original: mon gre ni myur ba'i rgyu skar te /
analyzed: mon gre ni myur ba'i rgyu skar te /
translated: Maghā is the swift lunar mansion.

original: mchod pa'i las thams cad dang / bram ze'i rig byed bklags pa dang / khrus bya ba dang / rgyal por dbang bskur ba dang / bram ze'i las bya ba dang / tshong dpon bsko ba dang / grong khyer gyi tshogs kyi dpon bsko ba la bzang ngo //
analyzed: mchod pa'i las thams cad dang / bram ze'i rig byed bklags pa dang / khrus bya ba dang / rgyal por dbang bskur ba dang / bram ze'i las bya ba dang / tshong dpon bsko ba dang / grong khyer gyi tshogs kyi dpon bsko ba la bzang ngo //
translated: It is good for all the rites of worship, for reading the Vedas of the brahmins, for bathing, for anointing a king, for the rites of the brahmins, for appointing a guild master, and for appointing the head of a city council.

original: de la skyes pa ni yid gzhungs zhing grags pa dang ldan pa longs sbyod che la nor mang dang / bu mang zhing dul ba'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la skyes pa ni yid gzhungs zhing grags pa dang ldan pa longs sbyod che la nor mang dang / bu mang zhing dul ba'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
translated: One born under it will be intelligent, famous, wealthy, and have many children and a disciplined nature.

original: stor ba dang / tshig pa dang / bsngams pa dang / bcings pa rnams dka' bas phyir thob bo //
analyzed: stor ba dang / tshig pa dang / bsngams pa dang / bcings pa rnams dka' bas phyir thob bo //

original: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni zhag bzhi'i bar du 'bab ste /
analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni zhag bzhi'i bar du 'bab ste /

original: mon gre'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: mon gre'i bya ba'o //
translated: This concludes the activities of Maghā.

translated: In Mondru, one should always practice medicine, one’s own work, and the work of protecting the kingdom. It is good for selling goods, selling beer, and for water to come there. It is good for planting sesame and lentils.

original: rgya mtshor tshong pa chas pa bzang ngo //
analyzed: rgya mtshor tshong pa chas pa bzang ngo //
translated: It is good for going to sea to trade.

original: de la rgyal po'i bka' gsal ba dang / sdig @414b pa'i las mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyal po'i bka' gsal ba dang / sdig @414b pa'i las mi bya'o //
translated: One should not issue royal proclamations or do sinful deeds.

original: pho nya btang ba dang / sgo srung dang / yi ge ba bsko ba dang / sman btu ba dang / sman btang ba dang / nyi ma de la gter brko zhing brdzang ba ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: pho nya btang ba dang / sgo srung dang / yi ge ba bsko ba dang / sman btu ba dang / sman btang ba dang / nyi ma de la gter brko zhing brdzang ba ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not send messengers, appoint doorkeepers, scribes, gather medicines, administer medicines, or dig up or give away treasure on this day.

original: gter sar ba bzhag cing sman bza' bar bzang zhing /
analyzed: gter sar ba bzhag cing sman bza' bar bzang zhing /
translated: It is good for placing treasure, and for eating medicine.

original: stor ba yun ring po nas btsal ba rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stor ba yun ring po nas btsal ba rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will find what has been lost after a long search.

original: de la skyes pa ni nad med pa dang / khro zhing gnyid che bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: de la skyes pa ni nad med pa dang / khro zhing gnyid che bar 'gyur te //
translated: For men, it brings health, anger, and much sleep.

original: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni legs par 'bab par bstan to //
analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni legs par 'bab par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that rain falling on that day falls well.

original: mon gru'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: mon gru'i bya ba'o //
translated: The activities of Mṛgaśiras.

original: khrums stod la ni drag po'i sbyor ba thams cad 'grub par brjod do //
analyzed: khrums stod la ni drag po'i sbyor ba thams cad 'grub par brjod do //
translated: In Mṛgaśiras it is said that all violent rites are successful.

original: smas pa dang / rims kyis btab pa de dag mi 'tsho bar bstan te /
analyzed: smas pa dang / rims kyis btab pa de dag mi 'tsho bar bstan te /
translated: It is taught that those struck by leprosy and fever will not live.

original: de la skyes pa dag ni rna ba gsang zhing longs spyod che la gnyen rnams yid du 'ong zhing nor che la las mthun par byed cing spro thung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la skyes pa dag ni rna ba gsang zhing longs spyod che la gnyen rnams yid du 'ong zhing nor che la las mthun par byed cing spro thung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those born on that day have secret ears, great wealth, pleasing relatives, great wealth, do work in accord with the karma, and are short-tempered.

original: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni drag por 'bab par bstan to //
analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni drag por 'bab par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that rain falling on that day falls violently.

original: khrums stod kyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: khrums stod kyi bya ba'o //
translated: The activities of Mṛgaśiras.

original: khrums smad la ni tshe ring ba dang / rgyas pa'i las bya'o //
analyzed: khrums smad la ni tshe ring ba dang / rgyas pa'i las bya'o //
translated: In Mṛgaśiras one should do rites for longevity and prosperity.

original: lho phyogs su mi 'gro zhing mi brtsam mo //
analyzed: lho phyogs su mi 'gro zhing mi brtsam mo //
translated: One should not go south or undertake anything.

original: de la skyes pa ni tshe ring zhing grags pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa dang / sum 'gyur gyis lto che zhing 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la skyes pa ni tshe ring zhing grags pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa dang / sum 'gyur gyis lto che zhing 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those born on that day have long lives, fame, longevity, and a belly three times larger than normal, and they are fearless.

original: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni bde bar 'bab par bstan to //
analyzed: nyi ma de la char bab pa ni bde bar 'bab par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that rain falling on that day falls well.

original: khrums smad kyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: khrums smad kyi bya ba'o //
translated: The activities of Mṛgaśiras.

original: nam gru la ni gser dang / dngul dang / rin po che dang / 'bru bsgrub pa dang / mdzod bya ba dang / rigs rgyud kyi bya ba dang / chang gi las kyi bya bar bzang zhing btang ba'i las @415a *//
analyzed: nam gru la ni gser dang / dngul dang / rin po che dang / 'bru bsgrub pa dang / mdzod bya ba dang / rigs rgyud kyi bya ba dang / chang gi las kyi bya bar bzang zhing btang ba'i las @415a *//
translated: In Mṛgaśiras, it is good for accomplishing gold, silver, jewels, grain, treasury work, family activities, and the work of brewing beer, and for giving.

analyzed: mi bya'o // lam sar pa gtod pa dang / chu bsgyur ba dang / khang par 'jug pa dang / mig sman sbyar ba dang / gos sar ba bgo ba dang / dbyig blang ba bzang ngo //
translated: It is good for setting out on a new road, changing the course of a river, entering a house, applying eye medicine, wearing new clothes, and taking up a treasure.

analyzed: de la skyes pa ni slong zhing sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan la phongs shing gnyen rnams kyis bsten cing chos shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If born then, one will beg and give, be moral, poor, be supported by relatives, and know the Dharma.

original: char legs par 'bab cing stor ba rnyed par 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: char legs par 'bab cing stor ba rnyed par 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: It is taught that rain falls well and the lost is found.

original: nam gru'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam gru'i bya ba'o //
translated: The activities of Mṛgaśiras.

original: tha skar la ni skyes pa dang / bud med dang / rta sbyar ba dang / me thab bya ba dang / rta bsgrub pa dang / shing rta bya ba dang / bu lon bya ba dang / sa bon gdab pa dang / rta dang /
analyzed: tha skar la ni skyes pa dang / bud med dang / rta sbyar ba dang / me thab bya ba dang / rta bsgrub pa dang / shing rta bya ba dang / bu lon bya ba dang / sa bon gdab pa dang / rta dang /
translated: For Aśvinī, it is good for a man, a woman, a horse, a fire ritual, acquiring a horse, a chariot, a loan, sowing seeds,

analyzed: glang po gdul ba dang / gar bya ba dang / sman sbyar ba dang / sman btang bar bzang ngo //
translated: taming a horse or elephant, dancing, compounding medicine, and taking medicine.

analyzed: de la skyes pa ni blta na sdug pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / rgyal po'i gnang chen phun sum tshogs pa dang / nad med pa la bu skye zhing skal pa bzang po ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: For a man, a birth will be beautiful, intelligent, endowed with the king’s great favor, healthy, and have a fortunate child.

original: char legs par 'bab cing stor pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: char legs par 'bab cing stor pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: There will be good rain and the recovery of lost items.

original: tha skar gyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha skar gyi bya ba'o //
translated: This is the activity of Aśvinī.

original: bra nye la ni skar ma gsum yod pas /
analyzed: bra nye la ni skar ma gsum yod pas /
translated: For Bharaṇī, there are three stars.

original: drag po'i las byas pa dang / bran dang / gla ba bsko ba dang / gla ba btsal pa dang / chung ma blang bar bzang ngo //
analyzed: drag po'i las byas pa dang / bran dang / gla ba bsko ba dang / gla ba btsal pa dang / chung ma blang bar bzang ngo //
translated: It is good for violent actions, hiring servants and laborers, seeking wages, and taking a wife.

translated: Those born under it will be quarrelsome, deceitful, dishonest, hypocritical, intelligent, sinful, and unclean.

original: de la snad pa dang / nad kyis btab pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la snad pa dang / nad kyis btab pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are wounded or sick under it will suffer.

original: 'gro ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should avoid traveling.

original: de la char nges par 'bab par de ltar drang srong chen po rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de la char nges par 'bab par de ltar drang srong chen po rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: The great sages have taught that rain will fall under it.

analyzed: rgyu skar de'i lha gshin rje yin pas shi ba'i phyir zas sbyin no //
translated: Since the deity of that lunar mansion is Yama, one should offer food for the dead.

original: de la skyes pa ni tshul khrims nyams shing bla ma la gnod pa dang / pha rol la gnod pa byed pa dang / brkam chags che ba dang / pha rol la dgra byed par 'gyur ta /

translated: Those born under it will be immoral, harmful to their superiors, harmful to others, greedy, and hostile to others.

original: bra nye'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: bra nye'i bya ba'o //
translated: This concludes the rites of Bharaṇī.

original: smin drug la sogs pa'i rgyu skar bdun dang / bra nye'i bar 'di dag las 'di ni bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: smin drug la sogs pa'i rgyu skar bdun dang / bra nye'i bar 'di dag las 'di ni bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: From the seven lunar mansions beginning with Aśvinī up to Bharaṇī, this is the summary:

original: de dag gi nang nas gang dag 'bru thams cad dang / sman thams cad phun sum tshogs pa la gnod par byed pa'i gza' gnas pas bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas gang dag 'bru thams cad dang / sman thams cad phun sum tshogs pa la gnod par byed pa'i gza' gnas pas bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Among them, one should protect those who are afflicted by the planets that harm the abundance of all grains and all medicines.

original: gzhan yang / rgyu skar rnams kyi ming gi le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rgyu skar rnams kyi ming gi le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the chapter on the names of the lunar mansions will be explained:

original: kye; padma'i snying po /
analyzed: kye; padma'i snying po /
translated: O Padma Garbha,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: rgyu skar bzhi po 'di dag ni bde bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu skar bzhi po 'di dag ni bde bar byed pa ste /
translated: These four lunar mansions bring happiness:

original: smad gsum dang / snar ma'o //
analyzed: smad gsum dang / snar ma'o //
translated: the three lower ones and Ashlesha.

original: de bram ze gnas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bram ze gnas par byed pa ste /
translated: They are inhabited by Brahmins.

original: de la gnas bya ba dang / rgyal po dbang bskur ba dang / gang so sor bstan pa'i las rnams bya bar bzang zhing /
analyzed: de la gnas bya ba dang / rgyal po dbang bskur ba dang / gang so sor bstan pa'i las rnams bya bar bzang zhing /
translated: On them, the performance of activities such as house construction, royal consecration, and individual teachings is excellent,

original: gzhan yang / de la bshig pa dang / bsreg pa dang / bcing ba rnams byas na bkra shis par 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de la bshig pa dang / bsreg pa dang / bcing ba rnams byas na bkra shis par 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: and it is taught that destroying, burning, and binding on them will bring auspiciousness.

original: gzhan yang / de la skyes pa bkra shis pa dang / sbyor ba chen po dang ldan par rig par bya'o //🔽kye / padma'i snying po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / de la skyes pa bkra shis pa dang / sbyor ba chen po dang ldan par rig par bya'o //🔽kye / padma'i snying po /
translated: Moreover, it should be known that on them, the birth of a man and the performance of great endeavors are auspicious.

original: rgyu skar bzhi po 'di dag @416a *//
analyzed: rgyu skar bzhi po 'di dag @416a *//
translated: These four nakṣatras

original: ni bde bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ni bde bar byed pa ste /
translated: are auspicious.

original: rgyal dang / me bzhi dang / byi bzhin dang / tha skar ste /
analyzed: rgyal dang / me bzhi dang / byi bzhin dang / tha skar ste /
translated: They are Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Maghā, and Mūla.

original: las bya ba la myur zhing kha ton brtsams pa dang / lam du 'gro ba dang / rgod ma bzhon pa dang / las rnams myur bar bya zhing mtshon gyi las dang / sman gyi las rnams bya zhing zla ba bzhi pa'i mchod sbyin bya bar brtsam mo //
analyzed: las bya ba la myur zhing kha ton brtsams pa dang / lam du 'gro ba dang / rgod ma bzhon pa dang / las rnams myur bar bya zhing mtshon gyi las dang / sman gyi las rnams bya zhing zla ba bzhi pa'i mchod sbyin bya bar brtsam mo //
translated: One should commence work that is swift, such as reciting a text, going on a journey, riding a mare, or doing work quickly, as well as work involving weapons and medicine. One should commence a sacrifice in the fourth month.

analyzed: gzhan yang / de la bshig pa dang / bsreg pa dang / bcing ba rnams bkra shis par brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that destruction, burning, and binding are said to be auspicious.

original: gzhan yang / de la skyes pa ni bkra shis shing longs spyod dang ldan pa'i rgyal por 'gyur ba dang / dbang phyug dang / longs spyod du ldan zhing gong ma la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i rgyal rigs su 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / de la skyes pa ni bkra shis shing longs spyod dang ldan pa'i rgyal por 'gyur ba dang / dbang phyug dang / longs spyod du ldan zhing gong ma la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i rgyal rigs su 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Moreover, if a male child is born, he will be auspicious, wealthy, and become a king; or he will be powerful, wealthy, and generous to his superiors, and will become a kṣatriya who is endowed with morality.

original: yang bram ze zhig mdun na 'don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang bram ze zhig mdun na 'don du 'gyur ro //
translated: and a brahmin will be the chief minister.

original: kye; padma'i snying po /
analyzed: kye; padma'i snying po /
translated: O Padmagarbha,

original: rgyu skar lnga po 'di dag drag po ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu skar lnga po 'di dag drag po ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: these five nakṣatras are of Rudra:

original: mchu dang / stod gsum dang / bra nye dang lnga ste /
analyzed: mchu dang / stod gsum dang / bra nye dang lnga ste /
translated: Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Kṛttikā, Maghā, and Mūla.

original: yang de dag la bshig pa dang / bsreg pa dang / bcing ba rnams mi 'tsho bar brjod do //🔽'di dag ni mngon sum ste /
analyzed: yang de dag la bshig pa dang / bsreg pa dang / bcing ba rnams mi 'tsho bar brjod do // 'di dag ni mngon sum ste /
translated: They are said to be inauspicious for destroying, burning, and binding.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: These are the nakṣatras that are direct:

original: lag dang / skag dang / sa ri dang / snron dang / mon gru zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lag dang / skag dang / sa ri dang / snron dang / mon gru zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Kṛttikā, Rohiṇī, and Mṛgaśirā.

original: cha shas dgu dang / dum bu drug go /
analyzed: cha shas dgu dang / dum bu drug go /

analyzed: sa ri dang / sa ga dang / lha mtshams dang / de dag ni thun mong pa dkyil 'khor bzhi pa'o // snron dang / snrubs dang / chu smad dang / chu stod dang / gro bzhin te /
translated: Āśleṣā, Maghā, and Pūrvāphālgunī are the fourth common maṇḍala.

original: de dag ni 'jigs pa chen por gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jigs pa chen por gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga pa'o //
translated: Pūrvāṣāḍhā, Uttarāṣāḍhā, Bharaṇī, and Kṛttikā are the fifth maṇḍala of great fear.

original: mon gre dang / mon gru dang / khrums gnyis dang / nam gru dang / tha skar dang / bra nye ste /
analyzed: mon gre dang / mon gru dang / khrums gnyis dang / nam gru dang / tha skar dang / bra nye ste /
translated: citrā, and svāti.

original: de dag ni thun mong ba'i dkyil 'khor drug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni thun mong ba'i dkyil 'khor drug pa'o //
translated: These are the six common maṇḍalas.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor las nad de dang de'i ljongs su de'i nad yin @419a *//
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor las nad de dang de'i ljongs su de'i nad yin @419a *//
translated: When a disease occurs in a particular maṇḍala of the lunar mansions, one should consider that disease to be in that region.

original: par lta'o // yud tsam bcu gnyis pa'i nyin par ni gza' bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: par lta'o // yud tsam bcu gnyis pa'i nyin par ni gza' bcu gnyis te /
translated: There are twelve muhūrtas in a day.

original: mtshan mo yud tsam drug drug rgyu ste /
analyzed: mtshan mo yud tsam drug drug rgyu ste /
translated: Six muhūrtas occur at night.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: dbyar zla ba rdzogs pa dang / nyin par la yud tsam bcu bdun yod cing nyi ma shar nas bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyar zla ba rdzogs pa dang / nyin par la yud tsam bcu bdun yod cing nyi ma shar nas bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the last month of summer, there are seventeen muhūrtas in a day. When the sun rises, it is the muhūrta called caturbhāga.

original: nyi ma 'phags nas ni rnam par 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma 'phags nas ni rnam par 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun has risen, it is the muhūrta called viśākha.

original: yud tsam bcu gsum dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo la yud tsam drug la yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam bcu gsum dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo la yud tsam drug la yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: On a night with thirteen muhūrtas, the six muhūrtas are called samāyoga.

original: tsha bas gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du nam nangs pa dang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsha bas gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du nam nangs pa dang 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun has set, the day is finished and the night begins.🔽The night of the first autumn month has sixteen muhūrtas.

original: dbyar gyi zla ba gnyis pa'i bco lnga la yud tsam bcu drug nyin par la yod cing nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyar gyi zla ba gnyis pa'i bco lnga la yud tsam bcu drug nyin par la yod cing nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun rises, the day begins with the muhūrta called caturbhāga.

original: phyed la ni mi pham zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyed la ni mi pham zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At noon, the muhūrta is called ajita.

original: nyi ma 'phags nas ni drag po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma 'phags nas ni drag po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun has risen, the muhūrta is called rudhiram.

original: yud tsam bcu bzhi dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo la ni nyi ma nub par rtsom pa rnam par rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam bcu bzhi dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo la ni nyi ma nub par rtsom pa rnam par rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The night of fourteen muhūrtas begins when the sun sets. The muhūrta is called prabhā.

original: mtshan phyed la ni sgyu ma chen mo zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan phyed la ni sgyu ma chen mo zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At midnight, the muhūrta is called mahāmāya.

original: nam nangs pa na ni me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam nangs pa na ni me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When dawn breaks, the muhūrta is called tapana.

original: rta 'thab pa'i bco lnga ni yud tsam bco lnga dang ldan pa'i nyin par la nyi ma 'char ba la ni bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rta 'thab pa'i bco lnga ni yud tsam bco lnga dang ldan pa'i nyin par la nyi ma 'char ba la ni bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The fifteen muhurtas of the horse race are the fifteen muhurtas of the day. The rising of the sun is the muhurta called catvarapramadana.

original: @419b nyi ma 'phags nas ni mi pham zhes bya ba'i rjes thogs la dbus ma zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @419b nyi ma 'phags nas ni mi pham zhes bya ba'i rjes thogs la dbus ma zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun has risen, the muhurta called amita follows, and the muhurta called madhyama.

original: nyi ma de las 'phags pa'i lha'i char zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma de las 'phags pa'i lha'i char zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun has passed that muhurta, the muhurta called devagati follows.

original: yud tsam bco lnga dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo nyi ma nub pa dang / drag po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam bco lnga dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo nyi ma nub pa dang / drag po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The fifteen muhurtas of the night begin with the setting of the sun and the muhurta called rudra.

original: mi pham pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam gyi rjes thogs la mtshan mo phyed du gyur nas nam nangs pa ni me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi pham pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i yud tsam gyi rjes thogs la mtshan mo phyed du gyur nas nam nangs pa ni me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the muhurta called amita and the muhurta called gati have passed, it is midnight. When dawn breaks, the muhurta called agni is reached.

original: rta 'thab pa'i tshes bco lnga la nyin mtshan mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i nyin par la /
analyzed: rta 'thab pa'i tshes bco lnga la nyin mtshan mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i nyin par la /
translated: On the fifteenth day of the horse race, the day and night are equal.

original: yud tsam bco lngar 'gyur zhing mtshan mo la yud tsam bco lnga'o //
analyzed: yud tsam bco lngar 'gyur zhing mtshan mo la yud tsam bco lnga'o //
translated: Fifteen muhurtas make up a day and night for the gods of the first meditation.

original: yud tsam nyin mtshan mnyam pa na nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam nyin mtshan mnyam pa na nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When a muhurta is equal in length to a day and night, when the sun rises, it is called the muhurta of the four high ones.

original: cha mnyam par dbus na gnas pa na mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha mnyam par dbus na gnas pa na mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun is in the middle of the sky, it is called the muhurta of equality.

original: nyi ma nub nas mtshan mo la bab pa na lha'i cha shas zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma nub nas mtshan mo la bab pa na lha'i cha shas zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun sets and night falls, it is called the muhurta of the divine portion.

original: mtshan phyed la ni mi pham pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan phyed la ni mi pham pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At midnight, it is called the muhurta of the invincible.

original: nam nangs pa na ni me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam nangs pa na ni me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When dawn breaks, it is called the muhurta of burning by fire.

original: ston zla 'bring po'i bco lnga la yud tsam bcu bzhi'i nyin mo la yod cing nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston zla 'bring po'i bco lnga la yud tsam bcu bzhi'i nyin mo la yod cing nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: On the fifteenth day of the middle autumn month, there are fourteen muhurtas during the day. When the sun rises, it is called the muhurta of the four high ones.

original: dga' bral dang mnyam pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i yud tsam gyi rjes la dbus su 'gyur nas nyi ma nub pa na chu zla zhes bya ba'i @420a *//🔽yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bral dang mnyam pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i yud tsam gyi rjes la dbus su 'gyur nas nyi ma nub pa na chu zla zhes bya ba'i @420a *// yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: After the moment called “door of equality with separation from joy,” it becomes the middle watch. When the sun sets, it becomes the moment called “moon in the water.”

original: mtshan mo la yud tsam bcu drug dang ldan la nyi ma nub na rgyud ces bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan mo la yud tsam bcu drug dang ldan la nyi ma nub na rgyud ces bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At night there are sixteen moments. When the sun sets, it becomes the moment called “stream.”

original: srid po zhes bya ba dang / mi pham pa zhes bya ba de'i rjes la mtshan mo phyed du gyur nas nam nangs pa na me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid po zhes bya ba dang / mi pham pa zhes bya ba de'i rjes la mtshan mo phyed du gyur nas nam nangs pa na me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: After the moments called “lord of existence” and “unconquerable,” it becomes midnight. When dawn breaks, it becomes the moment called “tormented by fire.”

original: dgun zla ra ba'i bco lnga la yud tsam bcu gsum dang nyin par ldan la nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgun zla ra ba'i bco lnga la yud tsam bcu gsum dang nyin par ldan la nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first autumn month, there are thirteen moments in the day. When the sun rises, it becomes the moment called “high four.”

original: phyed la ni dga' bral zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyed la ni dga' bral zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At noon it becomes the moment called “separation from joy.”

original: nyi ma nub pa la ni bden bral zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa la ni bden bral zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sun sets, it becomes the moment called “truthless.”

original: yud tsam bcu bdun dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo la nyi ma nub pa tsam na chu lha zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam bcu bdun dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo la nyi ma nub pa tsam na chu lha zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of sunset, when the night is endowed with seventeen muhurtas, it is the muhurta called Varuṇa.

original: mtshan phyed la ni srin po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan phyed la ni srin po zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At midnight, it is the muhurta called Rākṣasa.

original: nam nangs pa me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam nangs pa me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At dawn, it is the muhurta called Tapanī.

original: dgun zla 'bring po'i bco lnga la ni yud tsam bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i nyin par nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgun zla 'bring po'i bco lnga la ni yud tsam bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i nyin par nyi ma shar ba na bzhi mthon zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: On the fifteenth day of the middle month of winter, when the sun rises, it is the muhurta called Catuṣpāda.

original: dga' byed dang / dga' bral zhes bya ba'i rjes la dbus su 'gyur nas /
analyzed: dga' byed dang / dga' bral zhes bya ba'i rjes la dbus su 'gyur nas /
translated: After the muhurtas called Nandana and Nandī, it is the muhurta called Madhyama.

original: nyi ma nub pa na rdul med ces bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa na rdul med ces bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: At sunset, it is the muhurta called Virajā.

original: yud tsam bco brgyad dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo nyi ma nub tsam na bden bral zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam bco brgyad dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo nyi ma nub tsam na bden bral zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the night is endowed with eighteen muhurtas, at the time of sunset, it is the muhurta called Nirṛti.

original: bong bu dang / @420b srin po zhes bya ba'i rjes la mtshan phyed du gyur nas nam nangs pa na me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bong bu dang / @420b srin po zhes bya ba'i rjes la mtshan phyed du gyur nas nam nangs pa na me yis gdungs pa zhes bya ba'i yud tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The second half of the night is called the “donkey” and “rākṣasa” periods. When dawn breaks, it is the “torment” period.

original: ji ltar sos ga'i dang po de ltar dbyar dang po //
analyzed: ji ltar sos ga'i dang po de ltar dbyar dang po //
translated: The first month of spring is like the first month of summer.

original: ji ltar dpyid ka'i gnyis pa de ltar dbyar gnyis pa //
analyzed: ji ltar dpyid ka'i gnyis pa de ltar dbyar gnyis pa //
translated: The second month of spring is like the second month of summer.

original: ji ltar dpyid ka'i dang po de ltar ston dang po //
analyzed: ji ltar dpyid ka'i dang po de ltar ston dang po //
translated: The first month of spring is like the first month of autumn.

original: ji ltar dgun gyi bzhi pa'i de ltar ston tha chung //
analyzed: ji ltar dgun gyi bzhi pa'i de ltar ston tha chung //
translated: The last month of autumn is like the fourth month of winter.

original: ji ltar dgun 'bring de ltar dgun dang po //🔽ji ltar dgun 'bring de ltar sos ka'i gnyis //
analyzed: ji ltar dgun 'bring de ltar dgun dang po // ji ltar dgun 'bring de ltar sos ka'i gnyis //
translated: The first month of winter is like the middle month of winter.🔽The second month of spring is like the middle month of winter.

original: de lta bur ni rgyu skar rnams //
analyzed: de lta bur ni rgyu skar rnams //
translated: The movement of the lunar mansions

original: rgyu zhing rgyu bar shes par bya //
analyzed: rgyu zhing rgyu bar shes par bya //
translated: should be understood in this way.

original: rgyu skar rgyu ba dang po'i le'u 'o //
analyzed: rgyu skar rgyu ba dang po'i le'u 'o //
translated: This is the chapter on the movement of the lunar mansions.

original: ji ltar rgyu skar de dag gi nang nas nyin mtshan du ldan pas 'phel ba dang / 'grib par 'gyur bas 'gribs pa las nyin par 'phel ba'i bco lnga la zla ba phyed las gnyis pa dang / drug pa dang / dgu pa dang / bcu gnyis pa de dag mtshams kyi zhag 'das nas /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu skar de dag gi nang nas nyin mtshan du ldan pas 'phel ba dang / 'grib par 'gyur bas 'gribs pa las nyin par 'phel ba'i bco lnga la zla ba phyed las gnyis pa dang / drug pa dang / dgu pa dang / bcu gnyis pa de dag mtshams kyi zhag 'das nas /
translated: When the moon is waning, the fifteenth day of the waxing moon is the second, sixth, ninth, and twelfth day.🔽After the middle day has passed, the four great kings seize the moon.

original: nub mos 'dzin pa'i rgyal po chen po bzhi po shin tu 'chi ba zhes bya ba dang / rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba dang / 'phel ba zhes bya ba dang / tha dad pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba de dag 'thab pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi g-yo ba las sa 'gul lo //
analyzed: nub mos 'dzin pa'i rgyal po chen po bzhi po shin tu 'chi ba zhes bya ba dang / rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba dang / 'phel ba zhes bya ba dang / tha dad pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba de dag 'thab pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi g-yo ba las sa 'gul lo //
translated: The four great elements are shaken by the struggle between the four kings called Great Death, Pure, Increase, and Different Stages.

original: chu dang / dbang po dang / rlung dang / me ste /
analyzed: chu dang / dbang po dang / rlung dang / me ste /
translated: The four good ones are water, Indra, wind, and fire.

original: legs ldan rnam pa bzhi po'ang gang du zla ba phyed la lan gsum g-yos te /
analyzed: legs ldan rnam pa bzhi po'ang gang du zla ba phyed la lan gsum g-yos te /
translated: The four types of good ones move three times in a half-month.

original: zla ba gcig la lan drug g-yos par gyur na pha rol gyi dmag tshogs 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba gcig la lan drug g-yos par gyur na pha rol gyi dmag tshogs 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they move six times in a month, an army from a foreign land will come.

original: dpyid zla 'bring po @421a *//
analyzed: dpyid zla 'bring po @421a *//
translated: In the middle month of spring,

original: la g-yos na zhag bcu'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: la g-yos na zhag bcu'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: if there is an earthquake for ten days, there will be danger.

original: sos ka'i zla ba dang po la yang dang yang du g-yos na zhag bcu gnyis kyi bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sos ka'i zla ba dang po la yang dang yang du g-yos na zhag bcu gnyis kyi bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake again and again in the first month of summer, there will be danger for twelve days.

original: sos ka'i zla ba gnyis pa la yang yang g-yos na nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sos ka'i zla ba gnyis pa la yang yang g-yos na nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake again and again in the second month of summer, there will be danger for twenty-five days.

original: dbyar zla ra ba la yang yang g-yos na zhag bdun cu rtsa lnga'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbyar zla ra ba la yang yang g-yos na zhag bdun cu rtsa lnga'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake again and again in the first month of the rainy season, there will be danger for seventy-five days.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po la yang yang g-yos na zla ba gsum dang zhag bcu'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po la yang yang g-yos na zla ba gsum dang zhag bcu'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake again and again in the middle month of the rainy season, there will be danger for three months and ten days.

original: ston zla tha chung la yang yang g-yos na zhag lnga'i bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ston zla tha chung la yang yang g-yos na zhag lnga'i bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake again and again in the last month of autumn, there will be danger for five days.

original: dgun gyi zla ba gnyis pa la yang yang g-yos na zhag lnga bcu rtsa lnga'i bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgun gyi zla ba gnyis pa la yang yang g-yos na zhag lnga bcu rtsa lnga'i bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake again and again in the second month of winter, there will be danger for fifty-five days.

original: dgun gyi zla ba gsum pa la yang yang g-yos na zhag brgya'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgun gyi zla ba gsum pa la yang yang g-yos na zhag brgya'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake in the third month of winter, there will be danger for one hundred days.

original: dgun gyi zla ba bzhi pa la yang yang g-yos na zhag nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgun gyi zla ba bzhi pa la yang yang g-yos na zhag nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake in the fourth month of winter, there will be danger for twenty-five days.

original: dpyid zla ra ba la yang yang g-yos na zhag sum cu'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dpyid zla ra ba la yang yang g-yos na zhag sum cu'i bar du 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake in the first month of spring, there will be danger for thirty days.

original: de dag nis g-yos pa'i dus ji tsam na smin pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag nis g-yos pa'i dus ji tsam na smin pa yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows the time when the effects of the earthquakes will ripen.

original: de dag gi las kyi 'jug pa ni 'di ltar zla ba thams cad la dus rtag tu sa g-yo zhing shing dang / ri dang / chu rnams g-yo zhing shing rnams kyi lo ma ltar g-yon bskal ba lha bu'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi las kyi 'jug pa ni 'di ltar zla ba thams cad la dus rtag tu sa g-yo zhing shing dang / ri dang / chu rnams g-yo zhing shing rnams kyi lo ma ltar g-yon bskal ba lha bu'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar bstan to //
translated: The operation of these [earthquakes] is such that at all times and in all months, the earth shakes, and the trees, mountains, and waters shake. This shows that the danger of the sons of the gods will shake like the leaves of trees.

original: grong khyer @421b dang / grong dang / 'brog rnams na gnas pa'i mi rnams myur du 'pho zhing dgon par lo bco lnga'i bar du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grong khyer @421b dang / grong dang / 'brog rnams na gnas pa'i mi rnams myur du 'pho zhing dgon par lo bco lnga'i bar du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The people living in the cities, towns, and wildernesses will quickly move and live in the wilderness for fifteen years.

original: phyogs rnams nas sa rnam par g-yos na mi bde ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyogs rnams nas sa rnam par g-yos na mi bde ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is an earthquake from the east, there will be no misfortune.

original: smin drug la sa g-yos na grong khyer dang / grong rnams yang dang yang du mes bsregs pas rtsva 'ang mi lus par 'gyur ro //🔽de las rnam par g-yos na sol ba mkhan dang / nor bu mkhan dang / khye'u dang / mes skor byas pa'i gza' dang / de la skyes pa dang / lam du zhugs pa na zhing sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smin drug la sa g-yos na grong khyer dang / grong rnams yang dang yang du mes bsregs pas rtsva 'ang mi lus par 'gyur ro // de las rnam par g-yos na sol ba mkhan dang / nor bu mkhan dang / khye'u dang / mes skor byas pa'i gza' dang / de la skyes pa dang / lam du zhugs pa na zhing sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is an earthquake in the asterism of Bharaṇī, cities and towns will be repeatedly burned by fire, so that not even the grass will remain.🔽If there is an earthquake in the asterism of Āśleṣā, there will be misfortune for those who work with fire, for jewelers, for children, for those who are burned by fire, for those born under that asterism, and for those who have set out on a journey.

original: snar ma la sa g-yos na sa bon thams cad nyams pas 'bru rnams 'thob par mi 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba dang / bud med sbrum ma rnams mngal na nad 'byung ba dang / mu ge 'byung ba dang / smas pa dang / nad kyis btab pa'i mi rnams sum cha 'tsho bar 'gyur /
analyzed: snar ma la sa g-yos na sa bon thams cad nyams pas 'bru rnams 'thob par mi 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba dang / bud med sbrum ma rnams mngal na nad 'byung ba dang / mu ge 'byung ba dang / smas pa dang / nad kyis btab pa'i mi rnams sum cha 'tsho bar 'gyur /
translated: If there is an earthquake in the asterism of Maghā, all seeds will be destroyed, so that grain will not be obtained and there will be suffering, and pregnant women will have painful childbirth, there will be famine, and one-third of those who are wounded or sick will recover.

original: bdag nyid chen po dang / rgyal po dang / dpal dang ldan pa'i mi dang / mi'i mchog rnams nad kyis btab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po dang / rgyal po dang / dpal dang ldan pa'i mi dang / mi'i mchog rnams nad kyis btab par 'gyur ro //
translated: great beings, kings, glorious people, and the best of men will be afflicted with illness.

original: mgo la sa g-yos na sman rnams nyams shing sman pa dang / mchod sbyin rtsom pa dang / mchod sbyin byed pa dang / bram ze nags na gnas pa dang / dka' thub pa de dag la nad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgo la sa g-yos na sman rnams nyams shing sman pa dang / mchod sbyin rtsom pa dang / mchod sbyin byed pa dang / bram ze nags na gnas pa dang / dka' thub pa de dag la nad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is an earthquake at the head, medicines will fail, physicians, the beginning of sacrifices, those who perform sacrifices, brahmins living in the forest, and ascetics will be afflicted with illness.

original: lag las rnam par g-yos na 'o ma can gyi shing rnams nyams shing /
analyzed: lag las rnam par g-yos na 'o ma can gyi shing rnams nyams shing /
translated: If there is an earthquake at the hand, trees that yield milk will fail,

original: zas dang skom dkon zhing 'gron po yul 'khor chas pa dang / dong dang / 'obs brko @422a *//
analyzed: zas dang skom dkon zhing 'gron po yul 'khor chas pa dang / dong dang / 'obs brko @422a *//
translated: food and drink will be scarce, travelers will set out for the countryside, and those digging wells and moats

original: ba dang / sdig pa can dang / rgun ma rnams las g-yos pa'i nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba dang / sdig pa can dang / rgun ma rnams las g-yos pa'i nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be afflicted with the illness of sin and grapes.

original: yang nam so las rnam par g-yos na dkyil 'khor byed pa'i zhal ta pa dang / lam gyi nor can dang / lam du 'gro ba pa dang / 'khor lo ba dang / byis pa dang / srus mkhan dang / shan pa dang / dung 'tsho ba rnams las rnam par g-yos pas nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang nam so las rnam par g-yos na dkyil 'khor byed pa'i zhal ta pa dang / lam gyi nor can dang / lam du 'gro ba pa dang / 'khor lo ba dang / byis pa dang / srus mkhan dang / shan pa dang / dung 'tsho ba rnams las rnam par g-yos pas nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If there is an earthquake from the south, the king’s servants, those who are on the road, travelers, those who are in the army, children, butchers, and those who make their living from conch shells will be afflicted by disease.

original: rgyal la sa rnam par g-yos na bram ze rnams dang / de bzhin du gtso bo rnams dang / tshong pa rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / tshong pa ring por 'gro ba rnams la nad 'byung bar 'gyur zhing ser bas 'bru rnams rlog cing ri khrod na gnas pa'i rgyal po'i bsnyen bkur ba rnams sa rnam par g-yos pas nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal la sa rnam par g-yos na bram ze rnams dang / de bzhin du gtso bo rnams dang / tshong pa rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / tshong pa ring por 'gro ba rnams la nad 'byung bar 'gyur zhing ser bas 'bru rnams rlog cing ri khrod na gnas pa'i rgyal po'i bsnyen bkur ba rnams sa rnam par g-yos pas nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is an earthquake from the west, brahmins, leaders, merchants, captains, and long-distance traders will be afflicted by disease. Hail will destroy the crops, and the king’s attendants who live in the mountains will be afflicted by disease.

original: skag la sa rnam par g-yos na klu rnams dang / sbrul kha sdig pa rnams dang / grog mo rnams dang / grog phran rnams dang / sril rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / klu mgo gcig pa rnams dang / dug sngags mkhan rnams dang /
analyzed: skag la sa rnam par g-yos na klu rnams dang / sbrul kha sdig pa rnams dang / grog mo rnams dang / grog phran rnams dang / sril rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / klu mgo gcig pa rnams dang / dug sngags mkhan rnams dang /
translated: If there is an earthquake in the Śukra lunar mansion, nāgas, snakes, scorpions, ants, termites, worms, mice, and one-headed nāgas,

original: dug byed pa rnams dang / sems can khung du 'jug pa rnams sa rnam par g-yos pas nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug byed pa rnams dang / sems can khung du 'jug pa rnams sa rnam par g-yos pas nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: as well as poisoners, poison-makers, and creatures that enter holes will be afflicted with illness due to the earthquake.

original: mchu las rnam bar g-yos na rgyal po rnams la nad 'byung zhing mchod sbyin dang / shing @422b las log pa rnams dang / 'dus pa'i ston mo las log pa rnams dang / lha'i mchod sbyin las log pa rnams dang / de la log pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: mchu las rnam bar g-yos na rgyal po rnams la nad 'byung zhing mchod sbyin dang / shing @422b las log pa rnams dang / 'dus pa'i ston mo las log pa rnams dang / lha'i mchod sbyin las log pa rnams dang / de la log pa thams cad dang /
translated: If there is an earthquake in the Aśvinī lunar mansion, kings will become ill, and sacrifices, trees, assemblies, festivals, and divine sacrifices will be disrupted.

original: gang zhig de la skyes pa dang / bskyed pa dang / gang mkhas pa'i mchog tu gyur pa dang / glu mkhan rnams 'chi bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig de la skyes pa dang / bskyed pa dang / gang mkhas pa'i mchog tu gyur pa dang / glu mkhan rnams 'chi bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: All those who are born there, who are raised there, who become the best of the wise, and who are singers will die.

original: de dag dang / rigs mthon po rnams nad kyis thebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dang / rigs mthon po rnams nad kyis thebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the people of high rank will be afflicted by illness.

original: chu stod la sa rnam par g-yos na dus 'gyur zhing chos la dga' ba dang / sho gam gyis 'tsho ba rnams la sa g-yos na nad kyis 'thebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu stod la sa rnam par g-yos na dus 'gyur zhing chos la dga' ba dang / sho gam gyis 'tsho ba rnams la sa g-yos na nad kyis 'thebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is an earthquake in the first autumn month, there will be a change in the seasons and those who delight in the Dharma and those who live by customs duties will be afflicted by illness.

original: gal te chu smad la sa rnam par g-yos na tshod pa gling du 'gro ba rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / ri khrod na 'tsho ba rnams aang ga dang / lus 'phags po dang / ma ga dha pa rnams dang / ni ti'i bud med blangs pa rnams sa rnam par g-yos pa'i nad kyis thebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chu smad la sa rnam par g-yos na tshod pa gling du 'gro ba rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / ri khrod na 'tsho ba rnams aang ga dang / lus 'phags po dang / ma ga dha pa rnams dang / ni ti'i bud med blangs pa rnams sa rnam par g-yos pa'i nad kyis thebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is an earthquake in the second autumn month, those who travel to the island of Tsopa, merchants, those who live in the mountains, the people of Aṅga, Kaliṅga, Magadha, and those who have taken Nīti women as wives will be afflicted by the earthquake.

original: me bzhi la sa rnam par g-yos pas na rdza mkhan rnams dang / sman pa rnams dang / tshogs kyi gtso bo rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / dmag dpon rnams sa rnam par g-yos pa'i nad kyis thebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me bzhi la sa rnam par g-yos pas na rdza mkhan rnams dang / sman pa rnams dang / tshogs kyi gtso bo rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / dmag dpon rnams sa rnam par g-yos pa'i nad kyis thebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is an earthquake in the fourth autumn month, potters, physicians, leaders of the assembly, great ministers, and military leaders will be afflicted by the earthquake.

original: 'di ltar nam so la sa g-yos pa yang snga ma bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam so la sa g-yos pa yang snga ma bzhin du blta'o //
translated: Thus, the earthquake at dawn is to be viewed in the same way as before.
